Program Name: Alabama Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: On February 12, 2021, Governor Kay Ivey authorized AHFA to implement the State’s new COVID-19 emergency rental assistance program. Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) Alabama is funded entirely by a $263 million congressional grant under the Consolidated Appropriations Act of 2021 (the “Act”). Issuing a declaration of public emergency, AHFA is presently developing a program for processing online applications statewide, by landlords and renters. The online and phone system opens for applications from landlords and tenants on March 1, 2021 at 8 a.m. Central Time.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, ID
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Live in unsafe or unhealthy housing conditions; increasing debt or other sacrifrices to pay rent
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period, Rental Ledger, Landlord application if applying directly
Landlord Days to Respond Before Tenant C: 10 days / 3 attempts to email or contact
Types of Utilities Covered: Power, Water, Sewer, Trash, Natural Gas, Waste Services, Internet

Program Name: Baldwin County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Baldwin County is launching the U.S. Treasury Emergency Rental Assistance Program to provide emergency rental assistance to residents who are at risk of experiencing homelessness or housing instability due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The program is funded through the federal Coronavirus Response and Relief Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2020 (H.R. 133). This relief package includes $25 billion for emergency rental assistance, of which $6.6 million has been allocated to the county of Baldwin to provide assistance within the 14 municipalities. Both landlords and renters may apply. The program can provide assistance for past-due rent and forward rent payments for applicants.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past Due Utility Notice; Rent Cost is 50% or more of monthly take home pay/income AND Less than 3 months of rent in liquid savings
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Waive Late Fees, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period AND Future Months, Rental Ledger, Photo ID

Program Name: Birmingham Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Birmingham Emergency Rental Assistance Program is here to help Birmingham residents who’ve fallen behind in paying rent or utilities because of the pandemic. The program is also prepared to help landlords with tenants unable to make rent because of COVID-19. This program is ONLY for renters who live within the city limits of Birmingham.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Unsafe or unhealthy housing conditions; utilities turned off
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Rental Ledger, ID or Corporate Resolution (if incorporated entity)
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, water, gas, home energy

Program Name: City of Huntsville COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Huntsville received more than $6 million to distribute to those who qualify. Funds will be used to offer direct financial assistance on behalf of the tenant to landlords and utility companies to cover past-due payments of rent and utility/home energy costs. The goal is to prevent housing instability, potential eviction, and offer financial relief to qualifying tenants and landlords.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, ID for one household member on the lease
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utilities
Types of Utilities Covered: electricty, home energy

Program Name: Jefferson County Alabama Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Jefferson County Commission has approved a federally funded Emergency Rental Assistance Program for those Jefferson County renters that have been negatively impacted by COVID-19 and need help with rent and utility bills. Once again, the County has partnered with three organizations that will manage the program, Birmingham Urban League, Neighborhood Housing Services and Bridge Ministries. These organizations will be open for applications starting May 24th, 2021 at 8:00 am. Note, for residents who live in the City of Birmingham, they should apply through the City’s program link, but all other residents in Jefferson County should apply through this program.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, Photo ID
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utilities; AMI below 30%; currently living in hotel/motel; documentation that household is exiting a publicly funded institution
Types of Utilities Covered: internet, water, sewer, trash, power, and home energy costs

Program Name: Madison County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Madison County Emergency Rental Assistance Program (MCERAP) was created to help renters dealing with financial challenges related to the COVID-19 pandemic. For eligible households, the program offers rental and utility assistance to help Madison County renters avoid evictions and loss of utility services. Utilities include electric, water, gas, and sewer. Emergency Rental Assistance Programs were established by the Consolidated Appropriations Act of 2021.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, SSN
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility, unsafe or unhealthy living conditions, rent to income ratio of more than 30% of adjusted income
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Rent increase restriction during covered period
Types of Utilities Covered: electric, water, gas, sewer

Program Name: Mobile County Treasury Emergency Rental and Utility Assistance
Description: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, many Mobile County families are struggling to make ends meet. To assist during these hard times, Mobile County will launch the Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) Program to aid eligible households in need of rental and utility assistance.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, unsafe housing
Application Prioritization Specification: Tenants with need for rental assistance
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, gas, water and sewer, trash removal, and energy costs

Program Name: Tuscaloosa County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Tuscaloosa County Emergency Rental Assistance Program (TCERAP) is here to help. COVID-19 has affected residents across the state. We have emergency funds available to help Tuscaloosa County residents pay rent and utility bills (including past due rent and utilities).
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, Government issued ID; past due utility bills (if requested)
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Unsafe or unhealthy housing conditions
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, trash removal, and energy costs

Program Name: Mowa Choctaw Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: MoWa Choctaw Housing Authority is a tribally designated housing entity established to access, construct, and manage housing for tribal members. The Mowa Choctaw Housing Authority operates and maintains an affordable, safe, and decent rental housing and home ownership program within the counties of Mobile and Washington.  MCHA staff is available to assist with completing an application in our office in Mt. Vernon, AL.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability

Program Name: Alaska Housing Relief
Description: Are you struggling with rent and utility payments? Alaska Housing Rent Relief provides up to 12 months of rent and/or utility relief ​​​​​​to eligible Alaskans unable to pay rent and utilities due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Even if you've received rent relief from AHFC in the past, you can apply to this new program! The Alaska Housing Rent Relief application period ​opens on February 16th.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General)
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, Natural gas, Trash removal, Water/sewer, Home-heating fuel or oil, Propane, Firewood, Woodstove pellets

Program Name: Aleutian Housing Authority Emergency Rental Assistance Programs
Description: The Aleutian Housing Authority (AHA) was allocated over $3 million from the U.S. Department of Treasury for the implementation of the Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) program on behalf of our partner Tribes. The ERA program provides up to 12 months of financial assistance to eligible tribal and other AI/AN households residing in the Aleutian and Pribilof Islands region.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility, living in overcrowded conditions, delying purchase of essential goods/service to pay for rent, relying on credit cards or payday lenders to pay for rent, depleting savings to pay for rent
Types of Other Housing Expenses Covered: Relocation Expenses, Late Fees, Other Housing Expenses

Program Name: Bering Straits Regional Housing Authority Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: BSRHA was allocated over $8 Million from the U.S. Department of Treasury for the implementation of the Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) program on behalf of our partner Tribes. The ERA program provides up to 12 months of financial assistance to eligible tribal and other AI/AN households residing in the Bering Straits region.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility, living in overcrowded conditions, delying purchase of essential goods/service to pay for rent, relying on credit cards or payday lenders to pay for rent, depleting savings to pay for rent
Types of Other Housing Expenses Covered: Relocation Expenses, Late Fees, Other Housing Expenses

Program Name: Bristol Bay Housing Authority Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Bristol Bay Housing Authority can provide up to 12 months of rent and/or utility relief to eligible Alaskans that reside in the Bristol Bay region due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility, living in overcrowded conditions, delying purchase of essential goods/service to pay for rent, relying on credit cards or payday lenders to pay for rent, depleting savings to pay for rent
Types of Utilities Covered: electric, water, sewer, heating fuel, trash removal, internet

Description: Copper River Basin Regional Housing Authority can provide emergency rental and utility assistance for those impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic who meet certain eligibility criteria.

Program Name: Interior Regional Housing Authority Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Interior Regional Housing Authority is providing rental assistance to eligible households who have experienced hardship due to COVID-19.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Types of Utilities Covered: electric, gas, water, sewer, trash, heating costs,

Program Name: Kenaitze Indian Tribe Treasury Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Kenaitze/Salamatof Tribally Designated Housing Entity has a program for qualified Alaska Native and American Indians, who have disproportionately suffered from the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic, to provide emergency rental assistance for the payment of rent, utilities, and arrearages.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, SSN: Tribal ID
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility, unsafe or unhealthy living situation
Application Prioritization Specification: Waiting list preference in order of priority: 1. Kenaitze/Salamatof Elder - Disabled 2.  Kenaitze/Salamatof Elder 3. Kenaitze/Salamatof Member - Disabled 4. Kenaitze/Salamatof Member 5. Alaska Native 6. American Indian

Program Name: Arizona Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, the federal Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2021 authorized financial rent and utility relief for Arizona renters and landlords to be administered at the state and local level. Beginning on Tuesday, February 23, 2021, renters and landlords in the twelve Arizona counties listed below will be able to apply for the Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP) using the online ERAP portal. Applications will be accepted through the program’s expiration on December 31, 2021 or until funding is exhausted.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Utility Bills (if being claimed)
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Utility shutoff notice, Past due utility notice, Other evidence of unsafe or unhealthy living conditions
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period AND Future Months, Must agree that tenant has not moved/ been moved, and currently resides at location
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, gas, water, sewer, and trash removal

Program Name: Chandler Community Action Program
Description: If you can’t pay your rent, mortgage or utility bill, we can help. If you have experienced a loss of income or have unexpected expenses and are in need of assistance, the City of Chandler has funds that can help. If you’ve previously received rent/utility assistance, you are welcome to reapply for additional funding. Please apply for assistance through AZCEND’s Community Action Program or through the Chandler Salvation Army.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Administering Agency: AZCEND Community Action Program, Salvation Army - Chandler Rental Assistance

Program Name: Gilbert Emergency Rental & Utility Assistance Program
Description: The Gilbert Town Council voted to approve acceptance of $7.7 M in funds through the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2021, a federal COVID-19 relief bill. These funds are to be used for Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) services to assist Gilbert households that are unable to pay rent and utilities due to the COVID-19 pandemic and must be utilized by December 31, 2021. The $7.7M Gilbert received will be allocated to the following nonprofits to directly assist residents in need: $6,531,561 to AZCEND $1,200,000 to Save the Family
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Administering Agency: AZCEND and Save the Family CAP
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, gas, water, sewer, and trash removal

Program Name: Glendale COVID-19 Emergency Rent Assistance Program
Description: The City of Glendale Community Action Program is administering the COVID-19 Emergency Rent Assistance Program authorized and funded by the U.S. Department of the Treasury.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions, Allows tenant to adopt month-to-month lease if assistance is provided beyond lease term
Administering Agency: City of Glendale Community Action Program
Types of Utilities Covered: electric, gas, water, sewer, and/or trash

Program Name: Maricopa County  Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: Maricopa County households experiencing financial hardship due to the COVID-19 Pandemic may be eligible for Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) through the Human Services Department’s Community Services Division.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Utility shutoff notice, Past due utility notice, write of restitution, judgement related to eviction, show less than 7 days of pre-paid utility remaining
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Waive Late Fees, Eviction Restrictions
Types of Utilities Covered: electric, gas, water, sewer, and/or trash

Program Name: Mesa Emergency Rental and Utility Assistance Program
Description: The Emergency Rental and Utility Assistance Program was established in response to COVID pandemic financial impact to Mesa residents, funded through the U.S. Consolidated Appropriations Act of 2021. The program provides financial assistance to households financially impacted by COVID for rent and utility assistance to prevent eviction and homelessness.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, household member unemployed, past due utility bill, utility shut-off notice, less than 7 days of pre-paid electricity remaining on pre-paid accounty

Program Name: Pheonix City Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) Program
Description: The Mayor and members of the Phoenix City Council have approved distribution of $51 million in new federal Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) dollars to Phoenix residents who need help making their rent payments and covering the cost of home utilities.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, gas, water, sewer, and trash removal

Program Name: Tucson and Pima County Eviction Prevention/Emergency Rent and Utility Relief Program
Description: The U.S. Congress recently passed a stimulus bill that allocates additional rental assistance funding for those who’ve been affected by the coronavirus pandemic. In an effort to provide the most efficient and effective process, the City of Tucson and Pima County are in the final stages of approving funding distribution and it is anticipated that the Community Investment Corporation (CIC) will administer funding. This program allows for both Landlords/Property Managers AND Tenants to begin the application process and requires both parties provide information and documentation.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Utility shut-off notice, proof of unsafe living conditions
Application Prioritization Specification: ~3000 applications on previous waitlist prioritized, Tenant Household Income (as % of AMI), Time Unemployed, Months of Back Rent Owed, Risk of Homelessness / Unsafe Living Conditions, Date of Waitlist Application
Types of Utilities Covered: Electric, gas, propane

Program Name: Gila River Indian Community Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP)
Description: The Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP) makes available funding to assist households that are unable to pay rent and/or utilities due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability

Program Name: Navajo Housing Authority Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Navajo Housing Authority, the Tribally Designated Housing Entity for the Navajo Nation is a recipient of the Emergency Rental Assistance Program grant in the amount of $93 million.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General)
Types of Utilities Covered: gas, electricity, water, sewer, trash

Program Name: Pascua Yaqui Tirbe Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP) is an emergency relief program to help renters who are behind on their rent or utility payments.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, Tribal ID
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility

Program Name: Tohono O’Odham Ki:Ki Association Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: TOKA is happy to announce funding availability to assist renters affected by Covid-19 living in rental or lease purchase housing units. Priority of eligibility will be for members of the Tohono O’odham Nation, members of other tribes and non-tribal members until funds are depleted.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Tribal ID
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, trash removal, fuel oil

Program Name: White Mountain Apache Housing Authority COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability

Program Name: Yavapai-Apache Nation COVID Rental Assistance Program
Description: The purpose of the Yavapai-Apache Nation COVID-19 Rental Assistance Program is to assist Tribal Member households that are unable to pay rent and utilities due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Tribal ID

Program Name: Arkansas Rent Relief Program
Description: The Arkansas Rent Relief Program offers financial help to pay overdue and upcoming rent and utilities for eligible Arkansas renters. Landlords who have tenants unable to pay their rent because of lost income or the COVID-10 pandemic also may apply.  The state of Arkansas has $173 million of federal funding for this program. Once an application is approved, money would go directly to landlords and utilities companies.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, U.S. Citizens/Legal Aliens only
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Past Due Rent, Past due utlities
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period, Rental Ledger
Types of Utilities Covered: gas, water, and electricity

Program Name: Benton County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Benton County residents needing rental assistance due to the financial burden caused by the COVID-19 pandemic may be eligible for the new federal Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) Program. To apply, complete our Hark contact form or if you prefer to speak to someone on the phone, call 2-1-1.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Layoff letter, Unemployment claim, Tax documents, Pay stubs

Program Name: Pulaski County Emergency Rental Assistance Program (PCERA)
Description: PCERA is a government-funded assistance program designed to help keep Pulaski Co. families and individuals housed in the wake of the historic economic recession caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General)

Program Name: Washington County Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: Fayetteville Housing Authority ONLY received $1.5 Million which will serve approximately 350 families. Residents of Springdale should apply at the Springdale Housing Authority. Applications will be open until February 22 at 8 AM. After this time, there will be a lottery based that will prioritize the most vulnerable. More details will be published in the coming days.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability
Administering Agency: Fayetteville Hoising Authority and Springdale Housing Authority

Program Name: California's COVID-19 Rent Relief
Description: CA COVID-19 Rent Relief will help income-eligible households pay rent and utilities, both for arrears and future payment. The federal Consolidated Appropriations Act of 2021 provides funding to support the program and tenant protection laws signed by Governor Newsom. Both Landlords and Tenants can apply.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period, Rental Registry, Current Property Taxes
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water, sewer

Program Name: Alameda County Housing Secure Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ACHS-ERAP)
Description: The programs will help income-eligible households pay rent and utilities, both for past due and future payments. The federal Consolidated Appropriations Act of 2021 provides funding to support the program. Phase 1 of the program will launch on March 17, 2021. Phase 1 of the program will prioritize (1) tenant households making less than 30% of the area median income; (2) small rental property owners (5 units or less); and (3) tenants in subsidized affordable housing units. These priorities will be expanded in Phase 2.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utilities
Administering Agency: County Department of Housing and Community Development
Funding Limit Per Household (TOTAL): TOTAL: 100% of rental arrears in Phase 1, and 3 months prospective rent in Phase 1. In Phase 2, 80% of rental arrears and 100% of utility arrears. If landlords do not cooperate then 25% of rental arrears and 3 months of prospective rent.
Application Prioritization Specification: 30% AMI or less, tenants in subsidized housing, small rental property owners
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water, sewer

Program Name: Anaheim Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: We’re here to help. Anaheim’s coronavirus Emergency Rental Assistance Program, part of the City Council's Community and Economic Recovery Plan, has already helped nearly 800 struggling families with rent payments. Now, in a second phase of the program, we're offering help paying off rent debt from April 2020 to March 2021.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, Housing Instability, Current Lease
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions, Accept Decreased Payment Amount, Rental Registry
Types of Utilities Covered: electric, gas, sewer, trash or water

Program Name: Chula Vista Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP)
Description: Chula Vista  will  launch an application process by March 15 to distribute $16.8 million in state and federal funds to help qualifying residents pay past-due and upcoming rent, water, sewer, gas and electric bills. These payments are for Chula Vista renters affected financially by the COVID-19 pandemic.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility, Other evideince of unsafe or unhealthy living conditions
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Accept Decreased Payment Amount

Program Name: Keep Fremont Housed
Description: The City of Fremont's Keep Fremont Housed program can provide assistance for unpaid rent and utilities dating back as far as March 13, 2020, the date of the federal COVID-19 emergency declaration. Applicants may apply for rental assistance, utility assistance, or both.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Administering Agency: City of Fremont Family Resources Center

Program Name: Fresno Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The City of Fresno has received nearly $35 million from the federal and state governments to provide emergency rental assistance grants to improve housing stability in these unprecedented and uncertain economic times.  The City along with six community-benefit organizations (CBOs) will process the applications and provide relief to both landlords and tenants.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility bill
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Waive Late Fees, Future Rent Increase Restrictions, Accept Decreased Payment Amount, ACH form

Program Name: Fresno County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The County of Fresno received money from the US Treasury Department and the State Block Grant  for this program. The funds will be used for direct financial assistance to eligible renter households in the County’s jurisdiction that have been impacted due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions, Accept Decreased Payment Amount
Administering Agency: Fresno County and RH Community Builders
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water, sewer

Program Name: City of Irvine Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: To continue to mitigate the impacts of COVID-19 on Irvine’s residential renters, the City of Irvine, in partnership with Orange County United Way, will be allocating approximately $17.7 million for the Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP). OC United Way will be assisting the City in administering the ERAP. The application period will be from March 8 to March 19, 2021. This program is only eligible to residential renters in Irvine and is not available to commercial, industrial or other types of business-related tenants.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Accept Decreased Payment Amount
Administering Agency: City of Irvine and Orange County United Way

Program Name: Kern County Rent and Utility Assistance Program
Description: The Housing Authority of the County of Kern is now accepting applications for the Rent and Utility Assistance Program.  If you are a renter and were impacted financially by COVID-19 you may be eligible to receive short-term assistance for rent and/or utility costs.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease
Administering Agency: Housing Authority of the County of Kern

Program Name: Long Beach Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Long Beach Emergency Rental Assistance Program (LB-ERAP) is designed to assist landlords and income-eligible tenants (renters) who have experienced financial loss or hardship due to COVID-19 through rental assistance. LB-ERAP will help income-eligible tenants pay rent and utilities, both for past due bills and future payments. The program will prioritize assisting lower-income tenants who have been unemployed for 90 days or more and who are at risk of housing instability.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utilities
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions, Accept Decreased Payment Amount
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water, sewer

Program Name: City of Los Angeles Emergency Renters Assistance Program
Description: The City of Los Angeles, in partnership with the State of California and the federal government, has created the 2021 COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP)  to assist residential renters who have been unable to pay their rent as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. The Los Angeles Housing + Community Investment Department (HCIDLA) is charged with the implementation of the ERAP.
Tenant Eligibility: 50% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Waive Late Fees, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period, Accept Decreased Payment Amount, If the landlord doesn't accept the 80%, the tenant will be paid 25% directly
Administering Agency: Los Angeles Housing + Community Investment Department (HCIDLA)
Application Prioritization Specification: 30% AMI or less, past due rent

Program Name: Marin County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Marin County Rental Assistance online application is open.This program is a partnership between the County of Marin and local community-based organizations, including Adopt A Family, Canal Alliance, Community Action Marin, North Marin Community Services, Ritter Center, St. Vincent de Paul Society, West Marin Community Services and Women Helping All People.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period, Accept Decreased Payment Amount
