Description: The Broward County Commission, with funding from the federal Emergency Rental Assistance program, will be allocating emergency funding to eligible residents who are unable to pay rent and utilities due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Unspecified
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, trash removal and energy costs, such as fuel oil.

Program Name: Clay County Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: Clay County has received $6.6 million from the Department of the Treasury through the CARES Act to provide rental assistance to eligible households negatively impacted due to COVID-19 and the resulting economic impact. Clay County residents can apply to cover the financial obligation of three months of past due rent, internet services, and utility and home energy costs, including electricity, gas, water, and fuel oil, incurred from March 2020 to now. This county-wide program covers unincorporated areas and all municipalities.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Unspecified
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, gas, water, fuel oil, internet
Types of Other Housing Expenses Covered: Relocation Expenses, Internet, Other Housing Expenses

Program Name: Collier County Assistance Program
Description: The CCAP is providing financial aid to individual households and business owners with businesses in Collier County. This program is for individuals and families who have lost jobs, been furloughed or have experienced a reduction of income due to the COVID-19 pandemic and need financial assistance paying past due rent, mortgage payments and utility payments.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to mixed-status households
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility, unsafe or unhealthy living conditions
Administering Agency: Collier County Community and Human Services Division
Types of Utilities Covered: water, sewer, trash, electric, gas, internet

Program Name: Hialeah City Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The City of Hialeah Grants and Human Services Department shall provide rent and utility assistance (Water and Sewer, trash removal services, and electricity) for households who have been impacted by COVID-19. Eligible tenants can apply for financial assistance to be paid directly to their landlord or utility provider except as provided herein.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Administering Agency: City of Hialeah Department of Human Services
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, oil, water, sewer, trash, and internet
Types of Other Housing Expenses Covered: Relocation Expenses, Late Fees, Internet, Other Housing Expenses

Program Name: Hillsborough County Rapid Response Recovery Assistance Program (R3)
Description: Hillsborough County and the City of Tampa received federal funding to assist residents who are unable to pay rent and utilities due to the impacts of the COVID-19 coronavirus pandemic. The funding supports the Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP), which aims to prevent recipients from experiencing further financial hardship or additional consequences to living conditions by providing eligible and approved households up to $7,500 for past-due rent and up to $750 for past-due TECO utilities.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Unspecified
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Rental Ledger, Rental Registry

Program Name: City of Jacksonville Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP)
Description: The City of Jacksonville announced plans to use a $28.9 million grant from the federal Emergency Rental Assistance Program to help Duval County residents affected by the pandemic. The funds will be available to citizens to cover up to 12 months of rent and utility payments with the option for an additional three months if determined necessary to ensure housing stability. Partnering agency, the United Way of Northeast Florida, will distribute $23.8 million for rental assistance. The City will process the applications and work in partnership with JEA to distribute the remaining $5 million to thousands of eligible customer accounts with past due utility balances. The City will determine eligibility based on the standards below.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, U.S. Citizens/Legal Aliens only
Administering Agency: United Way of Northeast Florida, JEA, City of Jacksonville

Program Name: Lake County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Hillsborough County and the City of Tampa received federal funding to assist residents who are unable to pay rent and utilities due to the impacts of the COVID-19 coronavirus pandemic. The funding supports the Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP), which aims to prevent recipients from experiencing further financial hardship or additional consequences to living conditions by providing eligible and approved households up to $7,500 for past-due rent and up to $750 for past-due TECO utilities.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Unspecified, 2020 Tax Returns 1040

Program Name: Lee County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Lee County will pay up to six months of past due rent and utilities and three months of prospective payments for qualified households, plus ongoing payment of future rent as permitted. However, rental assistance cannot exceed a total of 12 months for each qualified household. The total months include past due, current due, and prospective payments.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Unspecified

Program Name: Leon County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: If you have been impacted by COVID-19, you may be eligible to receive assistance through Leon County’s Leon CARES Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP). The Leon CARES ERAP, approved by the Board of County Commissioners in January 2021, uses federal dollars to provide assistance to citizens experiencing financial hardship due to COVID-19. The Leon CARES ERAP provides assistance with rent, rental arrears, utilities, and utility arrears on behalf of eligible households.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified

Program Name: Manatee County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERA) provides funds to renters in Manatee County and its municipalities who are delinquent on rent and in need of rental payment assistance due to the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. Funds will be provided as a grant for rent and landlord-paid utilities for approved applicants. Eligible renters may receive grant funds up to 12 months of assistance, if needed, through November 2021, whichever is less. Funds will be paid directly to the landlord.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Types of Utilities Covered: Utilities paid by landlord and included in rent

Program Name: COVID Assistance Program (CAP)
Description: In response to the ongoing Coronavirus pandemic, United Way of Marion County received $10.8 million in Emergency Rental Assistance funds from Marion County to support individuals/families who have been impacted by COVID-19. Specifically for residents of Marion County, the COVID Assistance Program (CAP) provides rent and utility assistance to help support those community members who have been financially impacted by COVID-19.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Unspecified

Program Name: Miami Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: Miami plans to launch a new relief program that would provide a year’s worth of rent and utilities for struggling tenants who live inside city limits. On Thursday, the commission voted to dedicate about 90% of the city’s $14 million in federal COVID-19 relief funds to emergency rental assistance that will provide up to $24,000 for eligible households. About $12.7 million will go toward rent and utility payments. Applications are not open yet. The city is expected to launch the program soon. About $1.1 million will pay for administration of the program. Three local nonprofits will receive $100,000 each to help people stay in their homes: Sunshine For All; Neighborhood Housing Services of South Florida; and Legal Services of Greater Miami.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Administering Agency: Department of Housing and Community Development
Types of Utilities Covered: water and sewer, power, gas, and/or home Internet costs
Types of Other Housing Expenses Covered: Relocation Expenses, Late Fees, Internet, Other Housing Expenses

Program Name: Miami-Dade County Emergency Rental Program 2.3 (ERAP 2.3)
Description: The Emergency Rental Assistance Program 2.3 provides rental payment assistance for up to 12 months in arrears, if you meet certain income qualifications and are experiencing financial hardship as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. The amount of rental assistance you receive will depend on the amount of unpaid rent. The deadline to apply is 5 p.m. Monday, March 15.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified

Program Name: Okaloosa County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The program provides Emergency Rent and Utility assistance awards to eligible Okaloosa County landlords on behalf of their tenant residents who have experienced loss of income, reduction of working hours, unemployment, or significant additional expenses as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Rental Ledger, Rental Registry
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, trash

Program Name: Orange County Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: The Orange County Emergency Rental Assistance program is an income-based program aimed at helping Orange County’s most vulnerable tenants who are past-due in rent as a result of financial hardships caused by the COVID-19 pandemic. The program will distribute $33.4 million of federal funds to assist eligible Orange County residents.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Waive Late Fees, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period, Accept Decreased Payment Amount, Rental Ledger

Program Name: Orlando Rental Assistance Program
Description: The City of Orlando has been awarded $8.6 million in COVID-19 Relief Funds from the U.S. Department of Treasury to provide Emergency Rental Assistance for households that have been financially impacted by COVID-19.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified

Program Name: Osceola County COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Applications for COVID-19 Housing Assistance are available for citizens residing in Osceola County including City of Kissimmee and City of St. Cloud. You may qualify for the rental assistance.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Types of Utilities Covered: electric, gas, water

Program Name: Palm Beach County Rental Assistance
Description: The Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERA) is a fund authorized by the U.S. Department of Treasury Emergency approved by the Board of County Commissioners on March 9, 2021 to provide Palm Beach County residents with rental and utility assistance who are affected, directly or indirectly, by COVID-19 who are at risk of being homeless. The ERA funds are newly issued and have rigorous eligibility requirements, necessitating a thorough documentation and screening process. This program is for rental and utility assistance for renters only. Resources for home owners financially impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic are not covered with this funding.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, SSN
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility bill, utility disconnect notice
Types of Utilities Covered: Electric, Water, Gas

Program Name: Helping with Emergency Assistance Relief for Tenants (Pasco H.E.A.R.T.)
Description: Pasco County Community Development is partnering with multiple local agencies that are assisting in providing Emergency Rental Assistance to people experiencing economic hardship due to COVID-19.  Helping with Emergency Assistance Relief for Tenants (H.E.A.R.T.) will provide assistance to renters with funds distributed by the U.S. Treasury to Pasco County.  All partner agencies, listed below, are offering to help pay rental and utility bills directly for anyone living in Pasco County who meets the Pasco H.E.A.R.T. Program guidelines.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, U.S. Citizens/Legal Aliens only
Types of Utilities Covered: electric, Water, Gas

Program Name: Pinellas County Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: Through the Consolidated Appropriations Act of 2021, Pinellas County received a direct payment of $21.4 million to establish a local Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) Program supporting individuals and families who have lost their jobs or have had a significant reduction in income due to COVID-19. The City of St. Petersburg, the only other Pinellas County jurisdiction eligible for a direct payment, received about $8 million for St. Petersburg residents.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Unspecified

Program Name: Polk County Eviction Prevention Program
Description: Polk County's COVID-19 Eviction Prevention Program is available to provide funding to assist tenants who are unable to pay rent or utilities due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The program, using federally approved funds, assists Polk's most vulnerable tenants who are in imminent danger of eviction and provides property owners with an alternative to eviction. The program provides up to $7,000 in past due rent that will be paid directly to the landlord. The landlord will initiate the application process; however, both parties must agree to participate and meet eligibility requirements.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Current Lease, Unspecified

Program Name: Sarasota County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Sarasota County is a recipient of U.S. Department of the Treasury Emergency Rental Assistance funding. Eligible households may receive up to 12 months of assistance, plus an additional three months if the grantee determines the extra months are needed to ensure housing stability and grantee funds are available. Households may reapply for additional assistance at the end of the three-month period if needed and the overall time limit for assistance is not exceeded.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, U.S. Citizens/Legal Aliens only
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Past Due Rent, past due utilities
Administering Agency: Depatment of Health and Human Services

Program Name: Seminole County Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) Program
Description: The Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2021 (Pub. L. No. 116-260) established the $25 billion Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) program. The funding provided by the ERA program will assist eligible households that have difficulty making timely payments of rent and utilities due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Seminole County has received $14.2 million from the U.S. Department of the Treasury intended to provide rental assistance to eligible households negatively impacted due to COVID-19, and the resulting economic environment. Funds should be used to cover the financial obligation of rent and/or utilities. This County-wide program covers unincorporated areas and all municipalities and will remain open as long as funds are available.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Unspecified, SSN

Program Name: St. Johns County Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: The St. Johns County Emergency Rental Assistance Program provides aid to residents who are financially impacted by COVID-19 and at risk of housing instability. The program is federally funded and is designed to assist low-to-moderate-income households with rent-related expenses and utilities for up to twelve months or a maximum of $5,000.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, Government-issued ID, past-due utility bills (if requested)
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, unsafe or unhealth living conditions
Administering Agency: St. Johns County Health and Human Services
Application Prioritization Specification: seniors, veterans, a disabled family member, families with minor children
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, trash removal, energy oil

Program Name: St. Lucie County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP) provides up to twelve (12) months of financial assistance that can be used for rent (past due, current month), up to three (3) months of future rent if funding is available, and utilities. Applicants requesting utility assistance may only request for utilities in arrears (past due) and the current month due at the time the application is approved, with proof of current or past due bills.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, U.S. Citizens/Legal Aliens only

Program Name: St. Petersburg Rent and Utility Assistance
Description: The City of St. Petersburg has partnered with local non-profit organizations to provide short-term assistance for rent and utilities to individuals and families whose incomes have been affected by COVID-19.
Tenant Eligibility: Unspecified

Program Name: Volusia County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Emergency Rental Assistance program has over 16 million dollars available to assist households that are unable to pay rent and utilities due to the COVID-19 pandemic.  An eligible household may receive up to 6 months of assistance for rent or utilities, including past due rent and utilities.  Households must be re-certified every three months to continue receiving assistance.  An eligible household is a renter household in which at least one or more individual meets and can document the following criteria:
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMi or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Unspecified

Program Name: State of Georgia Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Georgia Department of Community Affairs will begin administering the State of Georgia Rental Assistance Program (GRA) in early March 2021. GRA can help renters with their past due rent and utilities. Payment will be made directly to landlords and utility providers.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period, Rental Ledger, Landlord application, proof of ownership

Program Name: Atlanta COVID-19 Emergency Housing Assistance Program
Description: The Atlanta COVID-19 Emergency Housing Assistance Fund is a program that provides financial assistance to eligible households for the payment of rent, rent arrears, security deposits, utilities, utility arrears, internet, water, sewer, and trash removal. This program seeks to fill the gaps for those, who have lost income because of COVID-19.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Types of Utilities Covered: gas utilities, electric utilities, water utilities, apartment security fees, security deposit, trash removal, and internet services

Program Name: Augusta-Richmond County Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: If you live in Richmond County and are in need of rent and/or utilities assistance, please click on the button below to complete our form where you will be placed in queue. A 211 specialist will be in touch with you as soon as possible. Please keep in mind that additional information may be requested, and thank you for your patience as we are experiencing a high volume of inquiries. ​
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Unspecified
Administering Agency: United Way of CSRA, Augusta-Richmond County Housing and Community Development Department

Program Name: Chatham County Rental and Utility Assistance Program
Description: The Emergency Rental Assistance Program is intended to assist households that are unable to pay rent and utilities due to the COVID-19 pandemic. In accordance with the grant’s guidelines, awarded funds must be used for direct financial assistance including rent, rental arrears, utilities, and utilities in arrears. Funds expire on December 31, 2021.
Tenant Eligibility: 50% AMI or less, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, SSN
Administering Agency: Chatham County, United Way of the Coastal Empire and Economic Opportunity Authority
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water, sewer, trash, oil

Program Name: Cherokee County Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: In an effort to provide assistance for Cherokee County residents affected by COVID-19, funds have been made available through the Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) program from the U.S. Department of the Treasury. Qualified renters who currently reside in Cherokee County may be eligible for assistance to help pay their rent, rental arrears, current utility and home energy costs, or utilities and home energy costs arrears and is designed to help residents avoid potential eviction.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Types of Utilities Covered: electric, water and natural gas

Program Name: Clayton County Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: The Clayton County Board of Commissioners plan to allocate an $8.7 million grant from the Department of Treasury for Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) to help prevent evictions and offer assistance for utilities.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, Unspecified

Program Name: Cobb County Rental Assistance Program
Description: Cobb County approved the allocation of another $22.8 million in federal Emergency Rental Assistance grants.  These grants are designed to help those impacted by the pandemic stay in their homes while struggling to recover.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Unspecified
Administering Agency: HomeFree-USA, Star-C Corporation, MUST Ministries, The Center for Family Resources, and Sweetwater Mission.
Types of Utilities Covered: electric, water and natural gas

Program Name: Dekalb Tenant-Landlord Assistance Coalition
Description: On February 9, 2021, DeKalb County CEO Michael Thurmond announced receipt of a $21 million grant from the Federal Emergency Rental Assistance program. CEO Thurmond convened a Tenant-Landlord Assistance Coalition comprised of public and nonprofit partners. The coalition will provide financial relief to DeKalb renters threatened by eviction and landlords facing revenue losses—both due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Administering Agency: DeKalb County Magistrate County, DeKalb County Marshal's Office, Atlanta Legal Aid, Goodwill of North Georgia, DeKalb Dispute Resolution Center, Housing Authority of DeKalb County and the DeKalb County Clerk of State and Magistrate Courts

Program Name: Forsyth County Emergency Rental & Utility Relief Program
Description: The Forsyth County Rent & Utility Relief Program has been established to provide short-term assistance for renters that can document income loss due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The funding is made available through a grant from the U.S. Department of Treasury and will be available beginning Monday, March 8. United Way of Forsyth County and The Place of Forsyth County Inc are the two agencies helping Forsyth County residents apply for the Federal Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP), managed by Forsyth County Government.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, SSN
Administering Agency: United Way of Forsyth County and The Place of Forsyth County Inc managed by Forsyth County govt.
Types of Utilities Covered: Electric, gas, water/sewer, trash

Program Name: Fulton County COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Fulton County has received $18 million through the United States Emergency Rental Assistance program. The purpose of Fulton County’s program is to provide financial assistance to eligible households for the payment of rent, rent arrearage, utilities, utility arrearage and other housing costs incurred due to the COVID-19 pandemic
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, SSN, Proof of any other assistance you've gotten since March 2020
Types of Utilities Covered: Water, gas, electricity

Program Name: Gwinnett County Project RESET
Description: Gwinnett County has received more than $28.1 million in stimulus funds through the federal Emergency Rental Assistance Program. These funds will be used to extend Project RESET to provide direct rental and utility assistance to income-eligible individuals and households financially impacted by COVID-19. Applications for this program will open in late April.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility
Administering Agency: United Way of Greater Atlanta and HomeFirst Gwinnett

Program Name: Hall County COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Renters in Hall County who need a little help due to the pandemic could be eligible for a new rental assistance program. The county government has established the COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance Program and will begin accepting applications on April 6 at 9 a.m.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, U.S. Citizens/Legal Aliens only
Allowable Areas of Self-Certification: COVID Hardship, Income, Income Non-Traditional, Housing Instability

Program Name: Henry County COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance Fund
Description: The Henry County COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance Fund is a program that provides financial assistance to eligible households for the payment of rent, rent arrears, security deposits, utilities, utility arrears, internet, water, sewer, and trash removal. This program seeks to fill the gaps for those, who have lost income because of COVID-19.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, U.S. Citizens/Legal Aliens only, SSN
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility
Types of Other Housing Expenses Covered: Relocation Expenses, Late Fees, Hotel/Motel Stays

Program Name: Department of Hawaiian Home Lands Rent Relief Program
Description: The purpose of the Department of Hawaiian Home Lands Rent Relief Program (DHHLRRP) is to provide financial assistance to native Hawaiians on the DHHL Waiting List who experienced financial hardship due to the COVID-19 pandemic and are renters in the state of Hawai'i. This program is being supported in whole, by federal award number 23.021 awarded to the Department of Hawaiian Home Lands by the U.S. Department of the Treasury.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Native Hawaiian, on DHHL waitlist; if cannot demonstrate COVID hardship, but demonstrate risk of homelessness or housing instability
Types of Utilities Covered: Electric, gas, water/sewer, trash

Program Name: State of Hawaii Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: The State of Hawaii distributed the $125 million in Federal allocations to Hawaiian counties to run localized emergency rental assistance programs. Hawaii, Honolulu, Maui, and Kauai Counties have funding available through their ERA programs. Renters and Landlords are encouraged to find the program that serves their  jurisdiction.

Program Name: Hawaii County Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP)
Description: Hawaii County partnered with seven local nonprofit organizations Thursday to launch an emergency rental assistance program for the island’s residents. The program will provide rent and utility grants to an estimated 3,400 households. Funds for the program were provided by federal grants.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Administering Agency: Hope Services Hawaii, Hawiian First Credit Union, Neighborhood Place of Puna, The Salvation Army, etc.
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, water, sewer, gas, internet

Program Name: Honolulu County Rent and Utility Relief Program
Description: The City and County of Honolulu is working with our community partners to develop the Rental & Utility Relief Program with $114 million in federal COVID-19 relief funds. Once the program opens, it will help qualified people on Oʻahu pay for their rent and household utility bills for electricity, sewer and water, and gas. It will pay up to 12 months of bills, depending on a person’s financial situation.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified, SSN
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility, unsafe or unhealthy living situation
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, water, sewer, gas, internet

Program Name: Kaua'i COVID-19 Rental and Utility Assistance Program
Description: The program is designed to help residents with rental and utility assistance. Eligible Kaua'i and Ni'ihau residents must have incomes of not more than 80% of the area median income (AMI), and can demonstrate a reduction of income due to the pandemic.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Unspecified
Administering Agency: Kaua'i Government Employees Federal Credit Union (KGEFCU)

Program Name: Idaho Housing and Finance Association's Housing Preservation Application
Description: The Housing Preservation Program was created to assist households with an inability to pay rent or utilities due to a COVID-19 related financial hardship.  The current funding source for this program will cover eligible costs April 1, 2020 and forward.  The application may be completed by a renter or by a housing or service provider action on behalf of a renter seeking assistance.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to mixed-status households
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Inability to pay future rent; income to housing cost comparison

Program Name: Boise Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP)
Description: The City of Boise/Ada County announced a new emergency rental assistance program for residents impacted by COVID-19. The program, administered by the Boise City/Ada County Housing Authority, can be used to pay past-due rent or utilities and future rent and utilities for up to three months. The combined $24.2 million is now available to help low-income renters who have fallen behind on their payments and could be at risk of eviction. These funds came from the U.S. Department of the Treasury, which allocated funds to localities over 200,000 people for rental assistance. $12.7 million went to Ada County and $11.5 was distributed to the City of Boise, but both agencies opted to have the housing authority distribute the funds in one central place.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Waive Late Fees, Eviction Restrictions
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, gas, water and sewer, trash removal and energy costs

Program Name: Nez Perce Tribal Housing Authority
Description: The Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP) was created to assist households with an inability to pay rent or utilities due to a COVID-19 related financial hardship. The current funding source for this program will only cover eligible costs incurred prior to December 31, 2021. Applicant eligibility requirements are: i. Inability to pay rent/utilities due to COVID-19 related financial hardship ii. A household member must be enrolled in a federally recognized Tribe. iii. Must reside within the 1855 Nez Perce Treaty boundaries iv. Have an income of 80% or less of the area median income.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, Household member must be enrolled in federally recognized tribe

Program Name: Illinois Rental Payment Program
Description: ILRPP is an emergency rental assistance program designed to support households in Illinois that are unable to pay rent due to the COVID-19 pandemic. We will launch the program in the near future. In the meantime, we have confirmed several program details that can help tenants and housing providers gather the information needed to apply when the program opens. As soon as the launch date is released, we will update this page, issue a press release, and post to our social media platforms.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Rental Registry, Current Property Taxes

Program Name: Champaign County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Champaign County residents in need of rental assistance can get help through a local program. The Champaign County Regional Planning Commission (RPC) is offering an Emergency Rent Assistance Program to help residents in the county with past due rent, water, power, and sewer bills.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Unspecified
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Rental Ledger, Landlord agreement

Program Name: Chicago Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The application period for the Chicago Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP) will open for tenants and landlords on this website beginning at 9 a.m. on Monday, May 24, 2021 and continuing through 11:59 p.m. on Tuesday, June 8, 2021. ERAP will provide grants of up to 12 months of unpaid rent and three months of future rent payments for eligible tenants and landlords.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Past Due Rent, Past due utility
Allowable Areas of Self-Certification: Income, Income Non-Traditional, Housing Instability, Lease

Program Name: Cook County COVID-19 Recovery Rental Assistance
Description: Designed for suburban Cook County renters and landlords who have experienced financial hardships due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the program pays up to 12 months of missed rent and utilities payments and up to 3 months of future rent payments.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General)
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Rental Ledger, Rental Registry

Program Name: Lake County Federal Emergency Rental Assistance (FERA)
Description: The FERA program helps low-income renters that have a financial hardship due to the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic. Eligible applicants can get help in the form of financial assistance for rent and utility bills.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified

Program Name: Madison County Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: Madison County is the recipient of a $7.8 million federal grant aimed at helping renters and landlords impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic. Community Development received $7,794,864 in grant funding from the Federal Emergency Rental Assistance program that will help the county prevent the eviction of renters in the upcoming months. Applications are available starting this week at participating intake sites or through the Madison County referral line (618) 296-5300.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, SSN
Administering Agency: Madison County Department of Community Development and local CAAs

Program Name: McHenry County Emergency Utility and Rental Assistance Program
Description: The McHenry County Emergency Utility and Rental Assistance Program will distribute $9.12 million allocated to the county through the COVID-19 stimulus bill signed into law Dec. 27. The program aims to reduce or eliminate pandemic-related evictions, prevent homelessness, avoid damaged credit that could hurt future housing opportunities for renters, and repair landlord/tenant relationships strained because of lack of payment. Landlords can apply for assistance as well.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Administering Agency: Department of Planning and Development  Community Development Division, McHenry County Housing Authority

Program Name: Winnebago County Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: Applications for the Emergency Rental Assistance Grant are now open!  If COVID-19 has impacted your ability to make rent payments, you may be eligible to receive help.  The money is available through a federally-funded $8.3 million grant which is meant to provide housing stability for renters and landlords.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Utility disconnected; Tenant signed Illinois' Exec Order 2020-72 halting evictions
Landlord Requirements: Future Rent Increase Restrictions, Rental Ledger, Current Property Taxes
Administering Agency: Winnebago County and Rockford Dept. of Human Services
Allowable Areas of Self-Certification: COVID Hardship, Income, Income Non-Traditional, Housing Instability
Types of Utilities Covered: Electric, gas, water, wastewater or sewer, trash removal, internet service (with conditions)

Program Name: Indiana Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: The Indiana Emergency Rental Assistance (IERA) program can provide eligible renters with up to twelve (12) months of rental assistance. Qualifying applicants may also receive utility and/or home energy assistance for past due utilities (electric, gas, water, sewer, and trash) and home energy (fuel oil, wood, coal, pellets, and propane) expenses and internet/ broadband assistance for past due internet expenses.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Unspecified
Types of Utilities Covered: Energy, Internet

Program Name: Elkhart County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Elkhart County ERAP makes funding available to eligible households to apply to past due and future payments for rent, utilities (water, sewer, stormwater, gas, trash and electricity) and internet. When possible, payments will be made on behalf of tenants directly to landlords  and utility companies. The goal of this program is to increase housing stability in Elkhart County.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Past Due Rent, Past due utilities
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, internet, trash removal, and energy costs, such as fuel oil

Program Name: Fort Wayne Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Emergency Rental Assistance Program (“ERAP”) provides funding to help qualified renter households pay for housing costs including  past due rent and utility bills and up to 3 months of future rent.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Administering Agency: Brightpoint,  Catholic Charities, Lutheran Social Services
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, trash removal and other energy costs, such as fuel oil

Program Name: Hamilton County Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP)
Description: Hamilton County officials announced the opening of the Hamilton County Emergency Rental Assistance Program (HC ERAP) for renters who have been financially impacted from COVID-19. Applications will be accepted beginning March 15 at 9 a.m.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water, sewer, trash removal, propane, and some internet costs

Program Name: Indianapolis Rental Assistance Program
Description: Indianapolis’ Rental Assistance Program will reopen on April 5. The announcement comes after the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention extended the federal eviction moratorium through the end of June. Renters are encouraged to submit their information on the waitlist on this website. People on the waitlist will have the first opportunities to apply.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Unspecified

Program Name: Lake County Emergency Assistance (LCERA) program
Description: The economic crises caused by COVID-19 has created a need for rental and utility assistance throughout Lake County. The Lake County Emergency Assistance (LCERA) program helps renters whose income has been impacted by the pandemic. Please see below for additional information.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease
Types of Utilities Covered: internet, home energy, water, gas, sewer, trash

Program Name: St. Joseph County’s Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA)
Description: St. Joseph County’s Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) is designed to decrease evictions, increase housing stability, and prevent homelessness by helping tenants whose income has been negatively impacted by COVID-19 with rent and utility payments. ERA can provide eligible tenants with up to twelve (12) months of rental assistance. Utility assistance may also be provided to qualifying applicants for past due utilities (electric, gas, water, sewer, and trash) and home energy (fuel oil, wood, coal, pellets, and propane) expenses.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility
Types of Utilities Covered: electric, gas, water, sewer, and trash, and home energy (fuel oil, wood, coal, pellets, and propane)

Program Name: Iowa Rent and Utility Assistance Program
Description: The Iowa Rent and Utility Assistance Program may provide eligible renters with help with rent and utility bills. Iowa received $195 million through the Department of Treasury to administer this program, which covers rental arrears accumulated since March 2020.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Waive Late Fees, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, gas, propane or fuel oil, water, sewer and/or trash removal

Program Name: Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP)
Description: IMPACT Community Action Partnership is administering rent assistance through the Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP) to residents of Polk County, including the City of Des Moines. This program may provide eligible residents of the City of Des Moines and Polk County with assistance for a period of up to twelve months. Applicants must be able to demonstrate a COVID-related impact to their household income that has affected their ability to pay rent.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, propane, water, sewer, and/or trash removal

Tribal Government/ Territory: Sac and Fox Tribe of The Mississippi In Iowa
Program Name: Sac and Fox Tribe of the Mississippi in Iowa Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Sac and Fox Tribe of the Mississippi in Iowa Meskwaki Housing Program will administer the Tribal Emergency Rental Assistance Program (TERAP) through local networks of nonprofit agencies starting June 1, 2021.  TERAP can provide rental and utility assistance for eligible renter households affected by COVID-19 so they can retain their housing stability.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Unspecified, Certificate Degree of Indian Blood or Tribal ID
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period AND Future Months
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, fuel oil, natural gas, water and sewer, trash removal
Location: Sac and Fox Tribe of The Mississippi In Iowa

Program Name: Kansas Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: The Kansas Emergency Rental Assistance (KERA) program provides rent, utility, and internet assistance to households experiencing financial hardship as a result of the COVID pandemic. Landlords and tenants apply via a joint online process. If the application is approved, the landlord or service provider receives funds directly from KERA and applies KERA funds to the applicant’s account. Approved applicants are eligible for up to 12 months of assistance.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Waive Late Fees, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period, Rental Ledger
Types of Utilities Covered: Electric, gas, water, sewer, trash services, internet expenses

Program Name: Wichita Emergency Rental Assistance Program (WERAP)
Description: Wichita residents can apply for assistance through the Wichita Emergency Rental Assistance Program (WERAP) administered by the city’s Housing and Community Services division, the city explained. The city’s online application opens next Monday (Feb. 22). Tenants may qualify for federal assistance if they earn no more than 80 percent of their area’s median income, are experiencing documented financial hardship as a result of the pandemic and could be at risk of housing or becoming homeless without assistance.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, gas, water and sewer, trash removal and energy costs,

Program Name: Healthy at Home Eviction Relief Fund
Description: Funding from the U.S. Treasury was sent to three Kentucky jurisdictions – the state of Kentucky, Lexington-Fayette Urban County Government, and Louisville-Jefferson County Metro Government. All three programs will offer the same rent assistance to approved applicants – 100 percent of past-due rent, dating back to April 2020, and up to three months of future payments.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period AND Future Months, Rental Ledger

Program Name: Housing Stabilization Partnership Program
Description: As Fayette County begins to rebound from the impacts of COVID-19, the Lexington-Fayette Urban County Government has established a Housing Stabilization Program to minimize trauma and crisis caused by lack of secure housing. This program will also reduce evictions, allow landlords to get substantial payments for back rent, reduce the potential spread of COVID-19 by allowing individuals and families to practice Healthy at Home, and reduce the impact on the homeless service delivery system.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Unsafe or unhealthy living conditions
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Waive Late Fees, Eviction Restrictions
Allowable Areas of Self-Certification: COVID Hardship, Income Non-Traditional, Housing Instability

Program Name: Jefferson County Rental Assistance
Description: Funding from the U.S. Treasury was sent to three Kentucky jurisdictions – the state of Kentucky, Lexington-Fayette Urban County Government, and Louisville-Jefferson County Metro Government. All three programs will offer the same rent assistance to approved applicants – 100 percent of past-due rent, dating back to April 2020, and up to three months of future payments.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease
Types of Utilities Covered: electric, gas

Program Name: Louisiana Emergency Rental Assistance Program (LERAP)
Description: The State of Louisiana is launching the U.S. Treasury Emergency Rental Assistance Program to provide emergency rental assistance to Louisiana residents who are at risk of experiencing homelessness or housing instability due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The program is funded through the federal Coronavirus Response and Relief Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2020 (H.R. 133). This relief package includes $25 billion for emergency rental assistance, of which $161 million has been allocated to the state to provide assistance in 57 Louisiana parishes.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Waive Late Fees, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period AND Future Months, Rental Registry
Administering Agency: State of Lousiana Office of Community Development

Program Name: East Baton Rouge Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The EBR Emergency Solutions portal is designed to rapidly and efficiently prioritize how City-Parish allocates resources currently received from the U.S. Treasury and anticipated resources connected to American Rescue Act. The City of Baton Rouge received a direct initial allocation of $6.5 million from the U.S. Treasury to provide rental assistance needs in response to the coronavirus pandemic, and is set to receive another $22.5 million to accommodate the level of need on the Louisiana Emergency Rental Assistance Program waitlist in the parish.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease
Application Prioritization Specification: Notified of eviction proceedings, applied to LERAP or similar program
Types of Utilities Covered: electric, gas, water, trash, sewage, cable or landline phone bill

Program Name: Caddo Parish's Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) Program
Description: Caddo Parish's Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) Program provides rental assistance for Caddo Parish renters facing COVID-related financial hardships.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease
Application Prioritization Specification: Applied for but didn't receive LERAP funds
Types of Utilities Covered: electric

Program Name: Calcasieu Parish Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Calcasieu Parish Police Jury’s Human Services Department will soon launch its Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) Program to help eligible residents with housing and rental expenses Human Services received $13 million in federal funds which it will used to fund the program. Those funds are part of $308 million the state of Louisiana received from the U.S. Department of Treasury to help residents with such things as rent, rent arrears payments, utilities, home energy costs, and other related expenses incurred because of the COVID-19 pandemic
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, SSN
Administering Agency: Louisiana Housing Corporation, Department of Administration, Office of Community Developmet
Application Prioritization Specification: Applied for but didn't receive LERAP funds

Program Name: Jefferson Parish Covid Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Jefferson Parish's Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP) serves eligible persons who, because of the COVID-19 emergency, now lack sufficient income or resources to pay rent.  The purpose of ERAP is to mitigate and assist very low- to low-income families and individuals who are suffering a temporary financial setback due to the COVID-19 public health emergency and who need help with delinquent residential rent. ERAP may serve to assist renters who have been unable to pay rent during the moratorium period.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Timely Rent Payment Pre-COVID
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Waive Late Fees, Eviction Restrictions

Program Name: Lafayette Parish Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: Starting Thursday, April 1, Lafayette Parish residents can apply for help in paying rent or utility. More than $7 million in federal funds have been sent to Lafayette to help low and moderate income families who are struggling because of the pandemic, Lafayette officials announced today.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less , COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease

Program Name: New Orleans Emergency Rental Assistance Program (NOERAP)
Description: U.S. Treasury’s Emergency Rental Assistance program made available $25 billion to assist households that are unable to pay rent and utilities due to the COVID-19 pandemic.  The City of New Orleans received $11.6 million from Treasury and anticipates receiving approximately $14 million from the State for rental assistance in Orleans Parish.
Tenant Eligibility: 60% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General)
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Waive Late Fees, Eviction Restrictions, Rental Registry, Waive court costs, cannot end month-to-month leases
Administering Agency: Office of Homeland Security and Emergency Preparedness (NOHSEP)

Program Name: St. Tammany Rental Assistance Program (STRAP)
Description: The St. Tammany Rental Assistance Program (STRAP) which will utilize $7.7 million from the Department of Treasury, is fully underway. This program is available to assist households that are unable to pay rent due to the COVID-19 pandemic. St. Tammany Parish Government has opened two locations, one on Koop Drive in Mandeville, and one in Slidell at the Towers building, for in-person applications. Officials are asking that applicants make an appointment to be served, by calling (985) 898-3016 or by emailing STRAP@stpgov.org.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability

Program Name: MaineHousing Emergency Rent Relief Program
Description: Maine has $200 million in rent relief funds from the federal Emergency Rental Assistance Program. This program will provide rental and utility relief payments to help eligible renters maintain housing stability. Maine’s Community Action Agencies will review applications, check eligibility, and process payments for eligible expenses on behalf of households.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Unspecified, If no COVID hardship, must have qualified for unemployment benefits between March 13 and date of application
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Borrowing money to pay housing costs, past due utlitiies
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, water, sewer, trash, heat, internet

Tribal Government/ Territory: Houlton Band of Maliseet Indian Housing Authority
Program Name: Maliseet Indian Housing Authority COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Maliseet Indian Housing Authority COVID Emergency Rental Assistance Program is open and accepting applications.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Unsafe or unhealthy living conditions
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, gas, water and sewer, trash removal, energy costs
Location: Houlton Band of Maliseet Indian Housing Authority

Program Name: Indian Township Tribal Government Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: Indian Township Tribal Government has received an allocation of funds from the Emergency Rental Assistance program due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Unsafe or unstable housing
Landlord Requirements: Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period, Future Rent Increase Restrictions
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, gas, water, sewer, trash removal, internet
Types of Other Housing Expenses Covered: Relocation Expenses, Internet, Other Housing Expenses

Program Name: Penobscot Nation Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: The Penobscot Nation has received Emergency Rental Assistance funds from the Department of Treasury to operate a 12  month rental assistance program for eligible households impacted by Covid-19.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, Tribal ID, SSN
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Unsafe or unstable housing, borrowing money to pay housing costs, staying with relatives, housing cost burdened
Application Prioritization Specification: Housing-related arrears that could result in eviction

Program Name: Maryland Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development will administer federal emergency rental funding in two ways, (1) directly to local jurisdictions through the Maryland Eviction Partnership Program to support local rental assistance efforts and (2) to property management on behalf of tenants residing in affordable rental properties​ that received federal or state financing through the Assisted Housing Relief Program. Local jurisdictions will operate rental assistance programs independently. All programs are expected to open in spring of 2021.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Waive Late Fees, Rental Ledger, Owner must offer tenant option to renew an expiring/expired lease for at least 90 days, in alignment with ERAP ability to pay prospective rent for 3 months at a time
Administering Agency: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development

Program Name: Arundel Community Development Services Eviction Prevention Program (EPP)
Description: The ACDS Eviction Prevention Program (EPP) provides financial assistance to help provide housing stability for Anne Arundel County renters who have been affected by the COVID-19 emergency. Households with incomes at or below 80% Adjusted Median Income (AMI) are eligible for EPP assistance upon completion of an application, including submission of documents to support and verification of the application. The EPP provides assistance to eligible households in three primary ways: 1. Payment of past due rent and/or utility bills; 2. Help with future monthly rent; and, 3. Relocation assistance for those households that must move because their lease has expired or they are living in unhealthy, unsafe or unstable conditions.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Unsafe or unhealthy living conditions
Landlord Requirements: Waive Late Fees, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period AND Future Months, Rental Ledger
Administering Agency: Anne Arundel Partnership for Children, Youth, and Families, Community Action Agency, Light House
Application Prioritization Specification: Households facing urgent circumstances (imminent or recent eviction)

Program Name: Baltimore City Eviction Prevention Program
Description: The goal of Baltimore City’s Eviction Prevention Program is to keep city residents in their homes. Any resident or family with a household income of 80% or less of AMI (Area Median Income) is eligible to apply. The program provides assistance with past-due rent and utilities payments, relocation, legal support and case management. If you meet income requirements, please complete the application as best you can. Once you submit your application, CAP Center staff will work with you to determine which form of assistance you are eligible for and works best for you.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, SSN or ITIN Number
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Moved 2 or more times in last 60 days, living in the home of another due to economic hardship, living in hotel or motel not paid for by charitable org/gov't agency, living in single room occupancy with 1.5 or more people, exiting publicly funded institution or system of care, household with minors earning less than 30% AMI
Administering Agency: Baltimore City Community Action Partnership, United Way of Central Maryland
Types of Utilities Covered: Water, electric, sewer, trash

Program Name: COVID-19 Eviction Prevention Program
Description: If you previously submitted an intake form for assistance between October 6, 2020 and February 12, your intake form will be reviewed for eligibility. You do not have to apply again if you submitted an intake form February 12, 2021 or earlier. All applicants will be contacted by one of the County’s partner organizations.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, Government issued ID
Administering Agency: Baltimore County, United Way of Central Maryland, Associated Catholic Charities, Baltimore County HCAP, Community Assistance Network, Episcopal Housing Corporation, Jewish Community Services, St. Vincent de Paul

Program Name: Frederick County Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Religious Coalition wants to remind all Frederick County residents who are struggling to pay rent to contact us for assistance.  Whether you were or were not affected by COVID-19, if you are behind in rent the Coalition may be able to help.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water, sewer, trash, fuel oil

Program Name: Harford County COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: HCAA is providing Rental Assistance to households affected by the Covid-19 Crisis in order to prevent pandemic related evictions.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Administering Agency: Harford Community Action Agency (HCAA), United Way of Central Maryland

Program Name: Howard County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Howard County Executive Calvin Ball on Thursday announced applications are now open for residents to receive rental relief and utility assistance from the $9.7 million in grant funding Howard was awarded from the U.S. Department of Treasury in January. Through the program, residents affected by the ongoing coronavirus pandemic can receive rental and utility assistance for up to 12 months regardless of whatever previous grant assistance they have received.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Administering Agency: Community Action Council, Grassroots,  FIRN, Springboard, United Way of Central Maryland

Program Name: Montgomery CountyRent Relief Program
Description: The COVID-19 Rent Relief Program provides short-term rental assistance to eligible households who have experienced lost income due to the COVID-19 pandemic that has caused them to fall behind on their rent. The program is managed by the County's Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS) with funding from the Department of Treasury's Emergency Rental Assistance Program.
Tenant Eligibility: 50% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status, Owe at least $1,000 in arears
Landlord Requirements: Waive Late Fees, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period AND Future Months, Offer lease renewal for a 90 day period if lease has expired
Administering Agency: Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS)

Program Name: Prince George's County Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP)
Description: The Prince George’s County Department of Housing and Community Development (DHCD) will offer relief to landlords on behalf of renters and tenants experiencing financial difficulties due to the COVID-19 pandemic through its 3rd round of funding for the Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP).
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Unspecified
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period AND Future Months, Rental Ledger, Property Deed
Administering Agency: Prince George's County Department of Housing and Community Development

Program Name: Massachusetts Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP)
Description: Federal Emergency Rental Assistance Program may provide up to 18 months of ​help with overdue and/or future rent (due on or after 3/13/20), ​as well as some help with utility costs.  Applicants must have had a COVID-related financial hardship.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Double up
Administering Agency: Department of Housing and Community Development

Program Name: City of Boston’s Rental Relief Fund
Description: The City of Boston’s Rental Relief Fund was established to help Bostonians at risk of losing their rental housing due to the COVID-19 pandemic. This fund is administered and managed by the Office of Housing Stability (OHS) in partnership with nonprofit housing agencies.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status, Cannot be a full time college student
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period AND Future Months, Proof of ownership, must participate in at least one mediation session if any issues arise with tenancy
Administering Agency: Office of Housing Stability, Metro Housing, Neighborhood of Affordable Housing, Project Hope
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, heating oil, natural gas

Program Name: Mashpee Wampanoag Tribe Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: To assist families with the ongoing Coronavirus pandemic, the Mashpee Wampanoag Tribe Housing Department is providing emergency mortgage and rent assistance.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, SSN, Tribal ID

Program Name: Michigan COVID Emergency Rental Assistance (CERA)
Description: The Michigan State Housing Development Authority (MSHDA) will administer the COVID Emergency Rental Assistance (CERA) Program through its network of local nonprofit agencies starting March 15, 2021. CERA can provide rental and utility assistance for eligible renter households so that they retain their housing stability.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period AND Future Months, Rental Ledger
# Months Utilities Covered: One-time (flat payment based on household size)
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, home heating (any type of fuel), water, sewer, trash, internet

Program Name: Macomb County COVID Emergency Rental Assistance (CERA) Program
Description: Behind on your rent? Facing eviction? Macomb County has teamed up with the Michigan State Housing Development Authority (MSHDA) to assist income-eligible residents stay in their home and pay their past-due rent. CERA, or the COVID Emergency Rental Assistance program, can provide rental and utility assistance for renters to help them maintain housing stability.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
# Months Utilities Covered: One-time (flat payment based on houshold size)
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, home heating (any type of fuel), water, sewer and trash

Tribal Government/ Territory: Bay Mills Indian Community Housing Authority
Program Name: Bay Mills Indian Community Housing Authority Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Bay Mills Indian Community Emergency Rental Assistance Program funded by the U.S. Department of Treasury was established to support Bay Mills Indian Community Members who have been negatively impacted due to COVID-19.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Unspecified, Tribal member or parent of minor child who is tribal member
Administering Agency: Bay Mills Indian Community Housing Authority
Types of Utilities Covered: electric, gas, water, propane
Location: Bay Mills Indian Community Housing Authority

Tribal Government/ Territory: Grand Traverse Band Of Ottawa And Chippewa Indians
Program Name: Grand Traverse Band Of Ottawa And Chippewa Indians Rental Assistance Program
Description: An application for rental assistance may be submitted by either an eligible household or by a landlord on behalf of that eligible household. Households and landlords must apply through programs established by Grand Traverse Band Housing. Eligible households may receive up to 12 months of assistance to ensure housing stability. The payments can cover rent, rental arrears, utilities and home energy costs, utilities and home energy costs arrears, and other expenses related to housing.

Program Name: Keweenaw Bay Indian Community COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: If you have been affected by the COVID-19 Pandemic the KBIC Housing Department now has a COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance Program to help alleviate costs. If you are a renter; needing a rent deposit; and/or have utility costs and are in need of financial assistance to maintain housing stability, you may be eligible for assistance.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, Proof of Tribal Membership or KBIC Direct Descendant
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Unsafe or unhealthy living conditions, rent/utilities are unaffordable, household struggles to buy essential goods/services, household takes outloans to afford rent

Tribal Government/ Territory: Lac Vieux Desert Band Of Lake Superior Chippewa
Program Name: Lac Vieux Desert Band Of Lake Superior Chippewa Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The goal of the Lac Vieux Desert Band of Lake Superior Chippewa Indians COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance Program is to provide emergency rental assistance for the payment of rents and utilities, and arrearages for the same, for low-income Tribal members who have disproportionately suffered from the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic. To participate in the ERA Program, an applicant or a landlord/owner acting on behalf of the Applicant must submit a complete, written application to the Tribe. If approved, they must then submit information and supporting documentation each month for the Rents and Utility Costs for which they seek continued Financial Assistance.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Unsafe or unhealthy living situtation
Administering Agency: Lac Vieux Desert Band Of Lake Superior Chippewa
Location: Lac Vieux Desert Band Of Lake Superior Chippewa

Tribal Government/ Territory: Little River Band of Ottawa Indians
Program Name: Little River Band of Ottowa Indians Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The COVID-19 pandemic poses an immediate and imminent threat to the health, safety, and well-being of the Tribe. The purpose of the ERA Program is to provide emergency rental assistance for the payment of rents and utilities, and arrearages for the same, for low-income Tribal members and other Indian families who have disproportionately suffered from the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic. The ERA Program is designed to assist Tribal and other Indian households whose income is at or below 80% of the Median Income who face potential eviction or homelessness because they are unable to pay rent and utilities due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified, SSN, Tribal ID
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility, unsafe or unhealthy living conditions
Application Prioritization Specification: One of more household members is a Little River Band of Ottowa Indians Tribal member, or one or more household members is a member of an Indian tribe and living on Little River Band land; one or more members of household unable to reach place of emplyment or place of employment closed due to COVID-19
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, trash, fuel oil
Location: Little River Band of Ottawa Indians

Tribal Government/ Territory: Little Traverse Bay Band of Odawa Indians
Program Name: Little Traverse Bay Band of Odowa Indians Covid-19 Emergency Rental Assistance Programs
Description: Are you behind on rent payments due to COVID-19? If so, contact the LTBB Housing Department. This program will pay for rental arrearage costs that have incurred due to COVID-19 (renters only, no mortgages). It is available to LTBB Citizens in any US State. Income restrictions will apply, based on individual state guidelines. Program is funded by the Department of Treasury and is only available until September 2021.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Unsafe or unhealthy living situtation, past due utility
Administering Agency: Little Traverse Bay Band of Odawa Indians Housing Department
Location: Little Traverse Bay Band of Odawa Indians

Program Name: Pokagon Band of Potawatomi Indians COVID-19 Emergency Assistance Program 2021
Description: Assistance is limited and subject to available funding for households either who have an increased need or job loss related need.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, Unspecified
Administering Agency: Pokagon Band of Potawatomi Department of Social Services

Tribal Government/ Territory: Saginaw Chippewa Indian Tribe Of Michigan
Program Name: Saginaw Chippewa Indian Tribe Of Michigan Covid-19 Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Saginaw Chippewa Indian Tribe’s Housing Department is now taking applications from eligible renter households. The following types of assistance are included: rent arrears, utility arrears, water/sewer, and trash removal arrears occurring after March 13, 2020; security deposit, and application fees; and prospective rent, utilities, water/sewer, and trash removal.

Location: Saginaw Chippewa Indian Tribe Of Michigan

Tribal Government/ Territory: Sault Ste. Marie Tribe of Chippewa Indians
Program Name: Sault Tribe Housing Authority Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Due to the COVID-19 Pandemic, are you at risk for housing instability? Facing Eviction? Behind on your rent or utilities? Income eligible members of the Sault Ste. Marie Tribe of Chippewa Indians and households who rent homes anywhere in the United States may make application for assistance. Emergency rental assistance can provide funding to assist with rental arrears, utility arrears, current and prospective rent payments, and prospective utilities and home energy costs and other housing expenses incurred related to housing due, directly or indirectly, to COVID-19 that qualify for assistance under federal law.

Program Name: Minnesota COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: The new program is called COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance and it will help eligible renters with overdue rent since March 2020, up to three months of upcoming rent at a time, and related utility payments. The program will be open for applications in a matter of weeks, with an anticipated launch in late March.  Eligible renters will include households that earned 80% or less of area median income in 2020 or in the most recent month. Landlords will be able to apply on behalf of their eligible tenants as well.
