Types of Utilities Covered: Gas, electric, water/sewer, garbage/recycling and other utilities as approved

Program Name: Bois Forte Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: Bois Forte Emergency Rental Assistance is available to those who are behind on utility or rent payments or anticipate having problems paying rent or utilities in the future due to the COVID-19 pandemic, who has household members enrolled at Bois Forte or are currently renting on the Bois Forte reservation. Those eligible may receive assistance for future and past due rent payments, utility payments, or internet service. Only renters are eligible-not homeowners-and rent /utility payments must be from March 13, 2020 forward.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified, Proof of Tribal Affiliation
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility

Tribal Government/ Territory: Fond du Lac Band of Lake Superior Chippewa
Program Name: Fond du Lac Reservation COVID Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: Eligible Fond du Lac households may qualify for emergency rental and utility assistance. This assistance will pay rental and rental utilities that are in arrears from 3/13/2020, due to COVID related unemployment, illness or other issues. Applicants may download the application above, or obtain a physical application at the Housing office. Submittals with any attached documentation may be emailed to the email address below, or dropped at the Housing office. The deadline to apply is December 13, 2021, 5:00 pm.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, Fond du Lac Reservation resident or Fond du Lac Band member or other Minnesota Chippewa Tribe

Location: Fond du Lac Band of Lake Superior Chippewa

Tribal Government/ Territory: Grand Portage Band of Lake Superior Chippewa
Program Name: Grand Portage Band of Lake Superior Chippewa COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance Program

Location: Grand Portage Band of Lake Superior Chippewa

Program Name: Leech Lake Band Of Ojibwe Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Through a federal grant, Leech Lake Human Services is able to assist individuals and families with expenses related to rent, utility and energy bills, and other household expenses.

Program Name: Mille Lacs Band of Ojibwe COVID Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: COVID-19 Assistance available under U.S. Treasury Emergency Rental Assistance funding
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, Government ID
Types of Utilities Covered: Water, garbage, propane, electric

Tribal Government/ Territory: Red Lake Band of Chippewa Indians
Program Name: Red Lake Band of Chippewa Indians COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: The COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance provides renters with assistance for the payment of rent costs and/or rental utilities. To qualify, you must be a Red Lake tribal member renting a residential dwelling on or off the Reservation. The application is available online one, accepted on a first-come, first-served basis until funding is eomplete.

Tribal Government/ Territory: White Earth Band of Chippewa Indians
Program Name: White Earth Covid Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: Emergency funding is now available through the COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance (CERA) program administered by White Earth Homeless Program. Funds are available for rent and rental utilities only. Applications are being accepted beginning March 1, 2021, through December 13, 2021 at 5 p.m.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, Tribal member or descendant, or federally-recognized tribal renter
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Past Due Rent, Past due utility
Types of Utilities Covered: electric, water/sewer, propane, fuel oil, trash
Location: White Earth Band of Chippewa Indians

Program Name: Mississippi Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Governor Tate Reeves has directed Mississippi’s Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) funding from The U.S. Department of Treasury to be administered by Mississippi Home Corporation. The funding will expand the income limit eligibility to assist more Mississippians who have been impacted by COVID-19.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past-due or disconnect notice from household's utility provider; Proof of medical bills preventing proof of payment of rent or utilities; Proof of reliance on credit cards or payday lenders to pay for household necessities; Other circumstances as described on the Risk of Experiencing Homelessness or Housing Instability Form, signed by the applicant.
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period AND Future Months
Allowable Areas of Self-Certification: COVID Hardship, Income Non-Traditional, Housing Instability
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, gas, water and sewer, trash removal, and energy costs

Program Name: Harrison County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: If you are a renter in Harrison County and lost your job to COVID-19, or could not work because you were sick, there’s now assistance that could help you. A $6 million grant awarded to the county through the CARES Act will be administered by the Open Doors Homeless Coalition. On Monday, the county released the first $650,000 monthly allotment to be distributed. The program can pay up to 12 months back rent and three months going forward. It will also provide other resources to help people recover from the pandemic’s economic impact.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Unspecified

Program Name: Hinds County Rental Aid
Description: The Hinds County Emergency Rental AID Program (HCERA) makes available $7 million to assist households that have been unable to pay rent due to the COVID-19 pandemic. An application for rental assistance may be submitted online by an eligible tenant, or a landlord can initiate an application on behalf of that eligible tenant. Available funding will be retroactive for past-due rent from March 13 2020 to the present and possibly three months in the future.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General)
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period AND Future Months, Proof of ownership
Administering Agency: Hinds County and the Integrity Group
Application Prioritization Specification: Households that have received a 3-day eviction notice

Program Name: Mississippi Band of Choctaw Indians Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Mississippi Choctaw Tribe has received a grant from the Emergency Rental Assistance Program. Renters at the Choctaw Housing Authority and the Choctaw Rental Housing Program may be eligible to have their rent and utilities paid for at least three months and possibly until December 2021.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified
Administering Agency: Choctaw Housing Authority, Choctaw Rental Housing Program

Program Name: Missouri State Assistance for Housing Relief (SAFHR) Program
Description: The State Assistance for Housing Relief (SAFHR) Program provides rent and utility assistance for households who have been impacted by COVID-19. Eligible tenants can apply for financial assistance to be paid directly to their landlord or utility provider. Financial assistance includes rent and utility arrears for the period beginning April 2020 and up to 3 months of forward rent and prepaid fuel utility assistance. The tenant must not owe rental arrears beyond any requested rental arrears through this program in order to apply for forward rent assistance. In order to receive utility assistance, tenants must have an invoice from the utility provider to support the request.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, Utility bills (if claimed)
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Unsafe or unhealth living conidtions
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period

Program Name: Clay County Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: Clay County received $3.6 million in funding from the Federal Government as part of the Consolidated Appropriations Act or second stimulus for an Emergence Rental Assistance Program. Clay County was a direct recipient due to having over 200,000 residents. The County’s portion of funds is for tenants needing rental and/or utility assistance in areas OUTSIDE of Kansas City, MO. Payments go to landlords and utility providers in order to make past due bills whole and potentially cover future needs.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility, other evidence of risk
Allowable Areas of Self-Certification: COVID Hardship, Income Non-Traditional, Housing Instability
Types of Utilities Covered: Electric, gas, water, sewer, bulk fuel

Program Name: Greene County Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: Greene County is the recipient of $8,765,982.70 as part of the U.S. Treasury Department’s Emergency Rental Assistance Program. To best reach those in need, Greene County has begun coordinating fund distribution efforts with area organizations and community partners that have existing experience with utility and housing assistance programs.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utilities, unsafe/unhealthy living conditions
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Waive Late Fees, Eviction Restrictions
Administering Agency: Greene County, Ozarks Area Community Action Corporation (OACAC), Consumer Credit Counseling Services, Community Partnership of the Ozarks, Catholic Charities of Southern Missouri, Council of Churches of the Ozarks, The Salvation Army

Program Name: Jackson County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The U.S. Congress passed a stimulus package to help communities and families affected by the COVID-19 pandemic in December 2020 that includes relief for renters. If you are behind in rent and/or utility payments, due to the impact of COVID-19 on your household, you may be eligible for assistance through the Emergency Rent Assistance Program launched by the US Department of the Treasury and administered by States, Counties and Cities. Community Services League and United Way of Greater Kansas City are assisting the Jackson County government in implementing their program, which assists households in Jackson County.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utilities
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Waive Late Fees, Eviction Restrictions
Administering Agency: Community Services League, United Way of Greater Kansas City, Grandview Assistance Program, Hope House, Lee's Summit Social Services and Raytown Emergency Assistance Program
Types of Utilities Covered: trash, electric, gas, sewer, water, or other power sources like propane

Program Name: Jefferson County Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP)
Description: Eligible households may receive up to 12 months of assistance, plus an additional 3 months if the grantee determines the extra months are needed to ensure housing stability and grantee funds are available. The payment of existing housing-related arrears that could result in eviction of an eligible household is prioritized. Assistance must be provided to reduce an eligible household's rental arrears before the household may receive assistance for future rent payments. Once a household's rental arrears are reduced, grantees may only commit to providing rental assistance for up to three months at a time. Households may reapply for additional assistance at the end of the the three-month period if needed.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease
Administering Agency: Jerfferson County and Jefferson Franklin Community Action Corporation
Types of Utilities Covered: trash, electric, gas, sewer, water, or other power sources like propane

Program Name: Kansas City Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The City of Kansas City, Mo. has received $14.8 million for emergency rental assistance. Our goal is to create an application process that is fair, fast, and equitable for KCMO residents. The funds will be distributed through existing community agencies that specialize in providing these services. Funding is provided by the second Congressional COVID-19 relief package.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utilities, unsafe or unhealthy living conditions, other evidence of risk
Types of Other Housing Expenses Covered: Relocation Fees, Late fees, Other Housing Expenses

Program Name: City of St. Louis Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The City of St. Louis Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA 1) Program is aimed at keeping families in their homes by helping income-eligible renters within the City of St. Louis who are past due in rent or utilities and have suffered financial hardship due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Administering Agency: St. Louis Department of Human Services
Types of Utilities Covered: water, sewer, power, gas
Types of Other Housing Expenses Covered: Relocation Fees, Late fees, Other Housing Expenses

Program Name: St. Louis County Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP)
Description: The St. Louis Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP) is a rental assistance program designed to provide relief to low- and moderate-income households residing in the County of St. Louis that are unable to pay rent and/or utilities due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status

Program Name: Montana Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: The Montana Emergency Rental Assistance program is being developed following the passage of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2021. Description: Blackfeet Housing has new funding available to assist renters with rental arrears, utility arrears, prospective (future) rent. Blackfeet Housing offers eligible households assistance with current or late rent, energy or  utility bills, and other housing costs dating back to the start of the pandemic.

Program Name: Chippewa-Cree Housing Authority Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Chippewa-Cree Housing Authority is pleased to announce a new program for low rent and Low Income Tax Credit Unit renters. nounce a new program for low rent and Low Income Tax Credit Unit renters!!! We were informed that we qualified for the Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP) through the US Department of Treasury. With the funds that were allocated to our housing authority, we will be able to assist our low rent tenants with rental payments that are in arrears, electricity payments that are behind, and other expenses related to incurred due, directly or indirectly , to COVID-19.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Unspecified
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, Internet
Types of Other Housing Expenses Covered: Relocation Expenses, Late Fees, Internet, Other Housing Expenses

Program Name: Fort Belknap Tribal Housing Authority Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Fort Belknap Emergency Rental Assistance Program provides rental relief to eligible tribal members for rental and utility arrears and future rent, utility, and other housing expenses. Funding comes from the Department of Treasury.

Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility, unsafe or unhealthy living conditions

Are you behind on rent or utilities due to COVID-19? This includes receiving unemployment, reduction in income, incurred significant costs, or other financial hardship. Is your household receiving income below 80% of the average median income for the area? This is up to $48,750/year for a single person; $69,600/year for a family of four.

Program Name: Nevada CARES Housing Assistance Program (CHAP)
Description: The Nevada Housing Division (NHD) has received approximately $124 million to provide additional temporary rental and housing expense assistance through the CARES Housing Assistance Program (CHAP). The CHAP program has served approximately 29,000 Nevadans to date. The additional funds are currently expected to help an estimated 20,000 households with rent and utilities.

Program Name: Clark County CARES Housing Assistance Program (CHAP)
Description: The CARES Housing Assistance Program (CHAP) serves residents of Clark County who have suffered substantial financial hardship and now lack sufficient income or resources available to pay their housing costs because of the COVID-19 emergency or the response to that emergency. Program is distributing Treasry funds under the 2021 iteration.

Description: A new federally funded New Hampshire Emergency Rental Assistance Program (NHERAP) will provide assistance to eligible residents of New Hampshire who cannot pay their rent and utilities due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Waive Late Fees, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period
Types of Utilities Covered: Electric, water, natural gas

Program Name: Fayetteville Cumberland Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The City of Fayetteville and Cumberland County’s Emergency Rental Assistance Program launches June 1. The goal is to distribute money received through the Consolidated Appropriations Act of 2021 to eligible residents who are unable to pay rent and utilities due to economic constraints from the COVID-19 pandemic. A total of $10,119,409 has been allocated to the City and County and is available to support the program. Residents of Fayetteville and Cumberland County who are renters needing assistance to cover past, current or upcoming rent or utility payments may apply online at fayettevillecumberlandRAP.com, by phone at 888-495-7710, or in-person by scheduling an appointment through the Customer Call Center at 888-495-7710.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified
Types of Utilities Covered: Internet and home energy costs

Program Name: Durham Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Emergency Rental Assistance Program serves North Carolina families whose household incomes do not exceed 80% of the Area Median Income for the county where they live, and are obligated to pay rent on a residential dwelling and meet both of the following conditions: financial assistance eligibility and can demonstrate a risk of homelessness or housing instability.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility, unsafe or unhealthy living conditions

Program Name: Gaston County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Gaston County’s Department of Social Services was awarded $6.7M by the federal government to help residents affected by the COVID-19 crisis with rent or utility payments. Gaston County DSS applied for the Emergency Rental Assistance Program on Jan. 12 and found out late last month it was awarded the funds to aid residents. The assistance is available now through the end of 2021.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Unspecified
Administering Agency: Gaston County’s Department of Social Services

Program Name: Greensboro Emergency Rental and Utility Assistance Program
Description: Applications are being accepted for rent and/or utility assistance under the federal Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP). Qualified households renting within Greensboro city limits may now apply for up to 12 months combined (past due + currently due + future) of emergency rent and/or utility payment assistance per household.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Past Due Rent, Past due utility
Types of Utilities Covered: gas, electricity, water and sewer, trash removal, energy costs such as for fuel oil, and internet

Program Name: Guilford Cares Rental/Utility Assistance Program
Description: Guilford County launched its new emergency rent and utility assistance program on Monday to help people who are facing financial hardships during the pandemic. The new grant program is designed to help people who are unable to make rent or utility payments as a result of COVID-19. The new Guilford Cares initiative kicked off by accepting applications beginning at 9 a.m. Eligible applicants can apply online on the county's website at www.guilfordcountync.gov.

The program is designed to aid households impacted financially by the COVID-19 pandemic with rent, utilities and other household costs. An outline of how to apply is included below.

This program provides financial assistance to tenants, landlords and utility companies to cover rent and utility shortfalls resulting from a financial hardship directly or indirectly due to COVID-19.

Description: The city of Winston-Salem and Forsyth County have received federal funds under the Emergency Rental Assistance Program to assist low-income residents who are behind on their rent or utilities payments because of the COVID-19 pandemic. The program is open to all renters residing in Forsyth County (including Winston-Salem, other incorporated municipalities in Forsyth County and in the unincorporated areas of the county)  who have a household income 80 percent or less of area median income (see chart below) and have been financially impacted by COVID-19. ERAP provides assistance with rent and utilities, to include electricity, water/sewer, trash removal, natural gas, propane, fuel oil and internet. Households may receive up to 12 months of assistance.

Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, water/sewer, trash removal, natural gas, propane, fuel oil and internet

Money will be used to help with rent assistance, utilities and up to 12 months of back rent.

Application Prioritization Specification: 30% AMI or less, Active/ at risk of eviction, Senior citizens 62+, expecting mothers
Types of Utilities Covered: Electric, gas, and/or water/sewer

Program Name: Toledo Lucas County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The new Toledo-Lucas County Emergency Rental Assistance Program will allocate $11,507,996 for direct rental assistance to benefit income-eligible tenants in Toledo and Lucas County. Since the federal eviction moratorium expired, housing displacement is a great concern in our community. Without rental assistance, housing stability for the most vulnerable residents in Toledo and Lucas County is in jeopardy. The new program will assist low- to moderate-income households in the city and county with up to 12 months emergency rental assistance. That may include payment for current and future rent, past due rent, late fees, new renter fees, security deposits, and utility deposits and payments.

Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period, Rental Ledger, Rental Registry

A public-private partnership, CCP distributes Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) allocated by the State of Oklahoma, City of Oklahoma City, Oklahoma County, and Clevland County to help our neighbors maintain housing stability.

Description: This program provides assistance for eligible applicants in the form of a grant in an amount to cover up to three months of dwelling rent and/or utility allowance payments. The assistance grant may be used to pay for arrearages not to exceed the three-month maximum.  The ERA funds may be provided once every three months subject to funding availability.  Emergency Rental Assistance is available to eligible applicants residing in Lincoln, Oklahoma, and Pottawatomie counties in Oklahoma.

Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Past Due Rent, Past Due utilities
Administering Agency: Housing Authority of the Kickapoo Tribe of Oklahoma
Types of Utilities Covered: electric, water, gas, propane, sewer, trash removal

Program Name: Kiowa Tribe Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Kiowa Tribe Housing Authority has received federal Emergency Rental Assistance through the Kiowa Tribe for tribal members whose financial situation has been affected by the COVID-19 pandemic for rent and utilities.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, Tribal ID
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utilities, unsafe or unhealthy living conditions
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, trash removal, energy costs, such as fuel oil, internet

Program Name: Modoc Nation Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: This purpose of this program is to assist eligible tribal households that are unable to pay past and current rent and utilities due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP) assists eligible tribal households that are unable to pay rent and utilities (electric, water, gas, propane, sewer, trash removal) due to COVID-19 pandemic. Telecommunication services (telephone, cable, internet) delivered to the rental dwelling are not considered to be utilities.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Open to mixed-status households, Tribal ID; SSN
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Past Due Rent, Past Due utilities
Types of Utilities Covered: electric, water, gas, propane, sewer, trash removal

Program Name: Muscogee Nation Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Muscogee (Creek) Nation Emergency Rental Assistance Program is utilizing funds provided from the Department of Treasury to provide emergency rental assistance up to $4,000 for eligible households across the United States. All assistance payments will be made directly to landlords and property managers on behalf of eligible households.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Open to mixed-status households, Tribal ID; SSN
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Past Due Rent, Past Due utilities

Program Name: Osage Nation COVID Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) Program
Description: It only serves Osage households who are low income, or newly low income due to layoffs, business loss, health issues or other financial factors directly caused by COVID. The service area has been expanded to serve Osages living in the entire State of Oklahoma. The program provides past due rent and utilities as well as future rent. It also assists with COVID caused relocation expenses.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Unspecified, Tribal ID; SSN
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Past Due Rent, Past Due utilities
Types of Utilities Covered: electric, water and gas / propane

Program Name: Otoe-Missouria Tribe of Indians Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP)
Description: The program provides financial assistance for rent or utilities (not both) for up to three (3) months based on application needs towards the following: 1. Rent or Rental Arrears, and 2. Utilities or utility Arrears - electric, gas, propane, water, sewer, trash removal arrears after dates 3/13/2020
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Unspecified, Tribal ID; SSN
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Past Due Rent, Past Due utilities
Administering Agency: Housing Department of the Otoe-Missouria Tribe of Indians
Types of Utilities Covered: electric, water, gas/propane/wood, sewer, trash removal

Program Name: Ottawa Tribe Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP)
Description: The Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP) assists eligible tribal households that are unable to pay rent and utilities (electric, water, gas/propane/wood, sewer, trash removal) due to the COVID-19 pandemic. ERAP can assist eligible households with rental arrearages, utility arrearages, current rental payments and current utility payments. Telecommunication services (telephone, cable, Internet) delivered to the rental dwelling are not considered to be utilities

Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Past Due Rent, Past Due utilities

Program Name: Pawnee Nation Housing Authority Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The temporary COVID Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) Program operates on supplemental funding from the U.S. Treasury Department to help combat the risk of homelessness caused by the COVID-19 pandemic. The ERA Program will serve Pawnee households who are low income, or newly low income due to layoffs or furloughs, business loss, health issues or other financial factors directly caused by the COVID-19 virus. Service area will reach Pawnees Nationwide and within the Pawnee jurisdiction.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Unspecified, Gov ID

Program Name: Quapaw Nation COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: The Quapaw Nation Housing Department has been awarded a grant through the Treasury Department for a COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance Program. This program makes available funds to assist households that are unable to pay rent and utilities DUE TO THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. Enrolled Quapaw tribal members will be given first priority. The Service Area for this assistance is: all of Ottawa County and within fifty miles of the tribal administration office in Quapaw into Kansas and Missouri.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Open to mixed-status households, Tribal ID; SSN
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, and home energy costs
Types of Other Housing Expenses Covered: Relocation Expenses, Late Fees, Hotel/Motel Stays, Other Housing Expenses

Program Name: Sac and Fox Nation Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The COVID-19 pandemic poses an immediate and imminent threat to the health, safety, and well-being of the Tribe. The purpose of the ERA Program is to provide emergency rental assistance for the payment of rents and utilities, and arrearages for the same, for low-income Tribal members and other Indian families who have disproportionately suffered from the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic. The ERA Program is designed to assist Tribal, Indian, and other households whose income is at or below 80% of the Median Income who face potential eviction or homelessness because they are unable to pay rent and utilities due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified, SSN; Tribal Enrollment Number for all applicable household members
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility, unsafe or unhealthy living conditions
Administering Agency: Sac and Fox Nation Housing Authority
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, trash removal, and energy costs
Types of Other Housing Expenses Covered: Relocation Expenses, Late Fees, Hotel/Motel Stays, Other Housing Expenses

Program Name: Seneca Cayuga Nation Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP)
Description: The program  assists eligible Seneca Cayuga Nation tribal households that are unable to pay rent and utilities (electric, water, gas, sewer, trash removal) due to the COVID-19 pandemic. ERAP can assist eligible households with rental arrearages, utility arrearages, current  rental payments and current utility payments. Telecommunication services (telephone, cable, Internet) delivered to the rental dwelling are not considered to be utilities.

Description: The purpose of the ERA Program is to provide emergency rental assistance for the payment of rents and utilities, and arrearages for the same, for low-income Tribal households who have disproportionately suffered from the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Unspecified, Tribal ID; SSN
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, and home energy costs

Program Name: Wyandotte Nation Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: The Emergency Rental Assistance Program assists eligible tribal households that are unable to pay rent and utilities (electric, water, and gas) due to the COVID-19 pandemic.  ERA can assist eligible households with rental arrearages, utility arrearages, current rental payments and current utility payments. Telecommunication services (telephone, cable, internet) delivered to the rental dwelling are not considered to be utilities.  This program is only available to rental households and does not apply to households with a mortgage or who currently own their home.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Unspecified, Tribal ID; SSN
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, and home energy costs

Program Name: Oregon Emergency Rental Assistance Program (OERAP)
Description: Oregon Housing and Community Services will distribute $204 million to qualified renters who have experienced financial hardship due to the coronavirus pandemic and are at risk of homelessness or housing instability. OHCS will begin administering the Oregon Emergency Rental Assistance Program (OERAP) program after federal regulations are detailed. OERAP can help low-income households with their past due rent and utilities. In most cases, payment will be made directly to the landlord or utility provider.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period AND Future Months, Rental Ledger
Allowable Areas of Self-Certification: COVID Hardship, Income, Income Non-Traditional, Housing Instability, Lease
Application Prioritization Specification: Household size, months behind on rent, 2020 wildfire impact, whether household lives in a census tract identified by Urban Institute Rental Assistance Priority Index with high prevalence of low-income renters
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, home energy costs, trash removal, internet, and bulk fuels
Types of Other Housing Expenses Covered: Relocation Expenses, Late Fees, Hotel/Motel Stays, Internet, Other Housing Expenses

Program Name: Clackamas County Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: If you are having trouble paying rent because your income was impacted by COVID-19, you may be eligible for rent assistance.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status

Program Name: Emergency Rent Relief of Lane County (ERRLC)
Description: Lane County will offer rent assistance to those who meet the criteria. Those who apply must be a renter in the county, have income at or below 80% of the Area Median Income, and have experienced loss of income due to COVID-19 or experienced financial hardship due to COVID-19. The area median income amount is $39,900 annually for a single person and $56,950 annually for a household of four, according to Lane County.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Administering Agency: Lane County Department of Health and Human Services
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, natural gas, water, sewer, trash removal, heating oil

Program Name: COVID Assistance Program
Description: To be eligible to receive assistance, one or more individuals within the household has experienced a reduction of income, incurred significant costs, or experienced other financial hardship due, directly or indirectly, to the COVID-19 outbreak and will be required to submit an application to determine eligibility. Households are eligible to receive assistance for financial obligations incurred after March 2020 and must be at or below 80% of the average median income.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Unspecified

Program Name: Multnomah County COVID-19 Rent Relief Program
Description: The COVID-19 Rent Relief Program is intended to provide assistance to households who have experienced a loss of income or who have increased health risks or needs due to COVID-19.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Accept Decreased Payment Amount
Administering Agency: Multnomah County, Portland Housing Bureau, Joint Office for Homeless Services, and Home Forward
Allowable Areas of Self-Certification: COVID Hardship, Income, Housing Instability, Lease
Application Prioritization Specification: Black, Indigenous and People of Color (BIPOC) communities experiencing the greatest adverse impacts from COVID-19

Program Name: Washington County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The U.S. Treasury Emergency Rental Assistance program makes available $25 billion nationally to assist households that are unable to pay rent, utilities, and other housing related expenses due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Approximately $280 million from the program fund has been allocated to the State of Oregon, and Washington County has a significant portion of these funds available to disburse to eligible households in the county. Under this program, eligible renting households may receive assistance to help stabilize their housing. Assistance may include current and past due rent, current and past due utilities costs, and other expenses related to housing. Additional assistance may be provided if determined necessary.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Unspecified

Program Name: Burns Paiute Housing Department Covid-19 Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: This is the Burns Paiute Housing Department (BPHD), Department of Treasury Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERA) application.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past utility bill, unsafe or unhealthy living conditions
Application Prioritization Specification: First Priority: Unable to reach their place of employment, loss of employment due directly to COVID-19 Second Priority: Tribal member, member of an Indian Tribe Third Priority: applicants experiencing a combination of difficulties from preexisting concerns which have become more problematic due to the effect of the pandemic
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, trash removal, energy costs
Types of Other Housing Expenses Covered: Relocation Expenses, Late Fees, Hotel/Motel Stays, Internet

Tribal Government/ Territory: Confederated Tribes of Grand Ronde Housing Department
Program Name: Confederated Tribes of Grand Ronde Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Emergency Assistance Program and the LIHEAP (Low Income Heating Energy Assistance Program) assists eligible Tribal Members with the following: Utility Assistance: where an emergency can be demonstrated with a Shut-off notice. LIHEAP payments will be counted as utility assistance through the Social Services Emergency Assistance Program.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Current Lease, Unspecified, Tribal ID
Administering Agency: Confederated Tribes of Grand Ronde Housing Department
Location: Confederated Tribes of Grand Ronde Housing Department

Program Name: Confederated Tribes of Siletz Indians Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) Program
Description: The purpose of the ERA Program is to provide emergency rental assistance for the payment of rents and utilities, and arrearages for the same, for low-income Tribal households who have disproportionately suffered from the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic. To participate in the ERA Program, an Applicant must first submit a complete, written Application on the forms provided by STHD.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Unspecified, Tribal ID; SSN
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, and home energy costs

Program Name: Confederated Tribes of Warm Springs COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) Program
Description: The ERA Program provides Financial Assistance to the following Eligible Households who earn 80% or less of the Area Median Income; 1. Tribal Members residing on/off the Reservation 2. Enrolled Tribal Members of any Federally Recognized Tribes residing in Jefferson, Wasco, Hood River, Gilliam, Clackamas, or Marion Counties 3. Any person living within the boundaries of the Reservation regardless of race. This assistance covers: Rent, Utilities, Internet, Communication Devices, Cable/Satellite payments (Arrears dating back to April 1, 2020 and for future use in 3-month increments) to help alleviate the financial hardships endured from loss of income and increased costs due to the COVID-19 pandemic
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status, Tribal ID; SSN
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, and home energy costs

Program Name: Coquille Indian Tribe Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) Program
Description: The purpose of the Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) Program is to provide emergency financial assistance for the payment of rent and utilities, and arrearages for the same, and other housing expenses for low-income Coquille Tribal members and other Indian families who have disproportionately suffered from the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic. This is a temporary program and assistance is subject to availability of funds.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status, Tribal ID; SSN
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, and home energy costs

Program Name: Pennsylvania Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: On February 5, 2021, Governor Wolf signed S.B. 109 into law, which officially designated the Department of Human Services (DHS) as the agency overseeing administration of the Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP) for the 49 counties that did not receive direct allocations. ERAP is now taking applications. Pennsylvanians can apply online through COMPASS. Some counties are not using the COMPASS application. If your county is not using COMPASS, you will be automatically directed to your local ERAP agency contact.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utilities
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water,  sewer, trash removal and energy costs, such as fuel oil, internet
Types of Other Housing Expenses Covered: Relocation Expenses, Late Fees, Hotel/Motel, Internet, Other Housing Expenses

Program Name: Allegheny County Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: Allegheny County will begin taking applications today for a federally funded assistance program. If you’re renting AND have been financially impacted by the pandemic, this may be the program for you. Allegheny County says in order to qualify, you must prove that you lost income or a job since March 13th of last year OR you have COVID-19 related increases in expenses such as medical bills or are taking care of someone in your home. The program is being made possible by the Department of Human Services and federal funding awarded to the County, City of Pittsburgh and the state.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Administering Agency: Allegheny County Department of Human Services
Types of Utilities Covered: Electric, Gas or fuel oil, Sewage, Trash removal, Water

Program Name: Berks County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Berks County Emergency Rental Assistance Program is designed to ensure housing stability by providing rental and utility payments to landlords and utility companies to keep residents in their homes during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utilities
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, trash removal

Program Name: Bucks County Emergency Rental Assistance (BERA)
Description: The BERA Program provides rental and utility assistance to eligible Bucks County tenants impacted by COVID-19. Both tenants and their landlords are encouraged to apply – either party can start the application. Landlords are able to apply and invite multiple tenants to participate in the program at one time.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Administering Agency: Bucks County Opportunity Council, Bucks County Housing Group, the YWCA of Bucks County and Legal Aid of Southeastern PA.

Program Name: Chester County Emergency Rent & Utility Assistance Program
Description: Individuals and families in Chester County who are facing challenges in paying rent and utility bills brought on by the pandemic, can receive help through the Chester County Emergency Rent & Utility Assistance Program.  Chester County has received $34.5 million from the U.S. Department of Treasury and the PA Department of Human Services, to help cover emergency rental and utility bills for individuals and families who have been severely impacted by COVID-19.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer; and energy costs such as fuel oil or propane

Program Name: Cumberland County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Nearly a full year into the COVID-19 pandemic and economic downturn, Pennsylvania housing agencies, including in Cumberland County, may finally have the chance to run an effective rent relief program. Millions of dollars are coming down the pipe from state and federal appropriations to help distressed renters and landlords. More importantly, the new funding appears to cede much more control to local agencies after the state’s more restrictive relief program flopped last year.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Past Due Rent, Past due utility
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Rental Ledger, Rental Registry
Administering Agency: Cumberland County Housing and Development Authority
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, fuel oil, water, sewer, trash removal, and internet

Program Name: Dauphin County Emergency Rent and Utility Assistance Program
Description: The County of Dauphin has received funds to help its residents with rental and utility arrears and payments.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, 2020 Tax Returns 1040
Types of Utilities Covered: water, oil, trash, sewer, gas, electric

Program Name: Delaware County Emergency Rental Assistance (DELCO ERA)
Description: The DELCO Emergency Rental Assistance (DELCO ERA) grant program helps renters who suffered disruption and loss of income due to the COVID-19 pandemic with assistance with rent and utilities. The U.S. Treasury and Commonwealth of Pennsylvania allocated $37.2 million to fund DELCO ERA. The County engaged Capital Access, Inc, a grants management firm based in the Delaware Valley, to assist with program management. All funds must be expended by end of 2021.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility notice
Administering Agency: Delaware County and Capital Access Inc
Types of Utilities Covered: Electric, Gas, Heating Oil, Water/Sewer, and Trash

Program Name: Erie County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Erie County Emergency Rental Assistance Program administered through ECCM provides rental and utility assistance to eligible Erie County tenants impacted by COVID-19. Both tenants and their landlords are encouraged to apply – either party can start the application. Eligibility is determined based upon tenant being eligible for the program.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Rental Ledger, Proof of ownership
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, and trash removal costs.

Program Name: Lackawanna County Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: ERAP can assist renters in Lackawanna County (all municipalities) with past due rent and past due utility bills for the amounts incurred due after 3/13/2020. In some cases, it can also pay forward rent payments for 3 months. This program is for anyone who is renting their residence (apartment, house, or mobile home) in Lackawanna County that was financially impacted by the pandemic and is at or under 80% AMI.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Past Due Rent, Past due utility

Program Name: Lancaster CountyCOVID-19 Emergency Rental and Utility Assistance
Description: The Lancaster County Rental Assistance Program is being established to provide rental and utility assistance to eligible households. Eligible households may receive up to 12 months of assistance. The payment of existing housing-related arrears that could result in eviction of an eligible household is prioritized.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility
Administering Agency: Lancaster County Housing and Redevelopment Authoriities
Allowable Areas of Self-Certification: COVID Hardship, Income Non-Traditional, Housing Instability
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, and trash removal costs.
Types of Other Housing Expenses Covered: Relocation Expenses, Late Fees, Other Housing Expenses

Program Name: Lehigh County Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP) is in place to provide families and individuals financial assistance for rent including: rent, rental arrears, utilities, and home energy costs incurred due, directly, or indirectly, to COVID-19.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, gas, water, sewer, trash removal and energy costs such as fuel oil

Program Name: Luzerne County COVID Rent and Utility Assistance Program
Description: The Emergency Rental and Utility Assistance Program provides assistance to Luzerne County Households that are unable to pay rent and/or utilities due to the COVID-19 Pandemic. Only rental households are eligible for assistance. (Homeowners are not eligible for assistance with mortgage or utility payments.)  CEO is accepting applications on behalf of the Luzerne County Office of Community Development.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period AND Future Months, Rental Ledger, Proof of ownership
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, gas, water, sewer, trash removal and energy costs such as fuel oil

Program Name: Montgomery County Rent and Utility Relief Program
Description: A funding program slated to help renters and landlords impacted by COVID-19 has returned to Montgomery County. The Rent and Utility Relief Program, administered by Your Way Home, allows eligible households to receive up to 12 months of assistance for rent and utility bills dating back to March 13, 2020.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability
Application Prioritization Specification: Household resides in a zip code of 19401, 19405, 19406, 19464, 19446, or 19027

Program Name: Northampton County Community Mediation and Eviction Diversion Program
Description: Financial assistance for rent relief is available for qualified renters and landlords who have been impacted by COVID-19.   Renters and landlords can apply for relief through the Pennsylvania Housing Finance Agency. If you are a resident of Northampton County, you should contact the following agencies to review your application and complete the submission for financial assistance. Bethlehem, Bethlehem Township & Hellertown/Saucon: New Bethany Ministries, 610-691-5602 x213 Easton: Easton Area Neighborhood Center: Ross Marcus, 610.253.4253 or  ProJeCt of Easton: Michael Banas, 610-258-1100 ext. 13  Suburban and Rural Towns & Townships of Northampton County: Third Street Alliance:  Ziana Keith, 610-438-1763        ​
Tenant Eligibility: Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified
Administering Agency: Catholic Charities, Easton Area Neighborhood Center, Lehigh Conference of Churches, New Bethany Ministries, Project of Easton and Third Street Alliance; Lehigh and Northampton counties; and local district courts

Program Name: Philadelphia Rental Assistance Phase 4
Description: Through the PHLRentAssist program, the City of Philadelphia offers emergency rental assistance to help tenants and landlords who have been impacted by COVID-19.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, past due utilities, paying over one-third of income on rent
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period, Rental Registry
Types of Utilities Covered: Electric, gas, water; $2,000 max per type of utility

Program Name: Washington County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Financial assistance may be available for Washington County residents who are experiencing homelessness or are falling behind on their rent or utility bills. This program helps people who are experiencing homelessness. It also helps people who are doubled up — that is, living with someone because they can’t afford a place of their own. It also helps people who are behind in their rent or utility bills and people with magistrate evictions.
Tenant Eligibility: Unspecified

Program Name: Westmoreland County Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP)
Description: Under the County’s ERAP an “eligible household” is defined as a renter household that has a household income at or below 80 percent of the area median and in which at least one or more individuals living in the household: qualifies for unemployment or has experienced a reduction in household income, incurred significant costs, or experienced a financial hardship due to COVID-19; and can demonstrate a risk of experiencing homelessness or housing instability; additional eligibility criteria will be added as the program is finalized.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified, SSN
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, past due utilities
Allowable Areas of Self-Certification: COVID Hardship, Income, Income Non-Traditional, Lease
Types of Utilities Covered: Electric, gas, water, sewer, internet

Program Name: York County’s Emergency Rent Assistance Program (ERAP)
Description: York County’s Emergency Rent Assistance Program (ERAP) is now accepting applications for rent relief and utility assistance for residents. Community Progress Council (CPC) has been selected by York County to disperse $13 million in federal relief money to those impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Administering Agency: Department of Human Services and Community Progress Council
Types of Utilities Covered: electric, natural gas, water, sewer and trash

Program Name: Rhode Island Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) program
Description: Rhode Island has received $200 million in rent relief funds from the federal Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) Program. This program will provide rental and utility relief payments to help eligible renters maintain housing stability.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Rental Ledger, SSN verification; Proof of ownership
Types of Utilities Covered: internet, electricity, water, trash, and heat

Program Name: Narragansett Indian Tribe Housing Covid-19 Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Narragansett Indian Housing Program is dedicated to providing affordable housing for Tribal members on or around the Reservation through its programs.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Unsafe or unhealth living conditions

Program Name: South Carolina Stay Plus
Description: SC Housing will launch in early May a $272 million program to assist South Carolina residents in need of rental and utility assistance whose finances have been impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic. Those who qualify for SC Stay Plus may receive up to 12 months of assistance for late rent payments and late utility payments dating back to March 13, 2020. S.C. residents in 39 counties are eligible to participate in the program. The following seven counties were directly funded by the U.S. Treasury Department and will provide their own rental assistance programs: Anderson, Berkeley, Charleston, Greenville, Horry, Richland and Spartanburg.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utilities, unsafe or unhealthy living conditions
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period, Rental Registry, Proof of ownership

Program Name: Anderson County AIM COVID Relief Fund
Description: Utilizing Coronavirus Response and Relief Supplemental Appropriations Act of 2021 funds, Anderson County is launching the COVID Relief Program (“CRF”). This program will provide residential rent and utility assistance for qualified residents of Anderson County.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Administering Agency: Anderson Interfaith Ministries,  Belton Interfaith Ministries (BIMA), Clemson Community Care, etc.
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, Gas, and Water

Program Name: Berkeley County Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: In response, Berkeley County has partnered with Civitas, LLC, a Charleston-based national community development consulting firm, to develop a plan to allocate the federal funds to qualified individuals. The County is opening an application period, for those in need of rental assistance, beginning Monday, March 29. The deadline to apply is 5 p.m. on April 16. Informational flyers about the ERA Program will also be mailed out with Berkeley County Water and Sanitation bills later this month.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified

Program Name: Charleston County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Emergency Rental Assistance program makes available funding from the U.S. Department of Treasury to assist households that are unable to pay rent and utilities due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Eligible renters and landlords in Charleston County are able to apply – find out if you’re eligible by going to the Renter or Landlord Application.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Rental Ledger, Rental Registry
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, trash removal, and energy costs

Program Name: Greenville Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Utilizing Coronavirus Response and Relief Supplemental Appropriations Act of 2021 funds, Greenville County is launching the Emergency Rental Assistance Program (“ERAP”). This program will provide residential rent and utility assistance for qualified residents of Greenville County.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, past due utility, utility shutoff notice, unsafe or unhealthy living conditions
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, and trash removal costs.

Program Name: Horry County Emergency Rental Assistance program
Description: The Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP) was created to help renters dealing with financial challenges related to the COVID-19 pandemic. For eligible households, the program offers rental and utility assistance to help residents of Horry County avoid eviction and maintain housing stability.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, past due utility, pay rent or quit notice, fleeing domestic violence, documented inability to pay prospective rent
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, and trash removal costs.

Program Name: Spartanburg County Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP)
Description: Spartanburg Housing has partnered with Spartanburg County to assist families who are in need of rent and utility assistance. If you are reaching out for rental or utility assistance as a result of hardship due to COVID-19, please complete the application below. Assistance is available for renters in Spartanburg County who meet income and hardship eligibility requirements.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified, SSN
Administering Agency: Spartanburg Housing, Middle Tyger Community Center, Upstate Family Resource Center, United Way of the Piedmont
Types of Utilities Covered: water, sewer, electricity, natural gas, propane

Program Name: Richland County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP) is a U.S. Treasury- funded program providing financial assistance to support Richland County renters who are unable to pay rent or utilities because of the COVID-19 pandemic.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, past due utility, unsafe or unhealthy living conditions
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, trash removal, energy costs, such as fuel oil, internet
Types of Other Housing Expenses Covered: Relocation Expenses, Late Fees, Hotel/Motel Stays, Internet

Program Name: South Dakota CARES Housing Assistance Program
Description: South Dakota Housing Development Authority with local partner agencies are providing emergency housing and utility assistance for South Dakota residents through Federal COVID Stimulus funds. If you have been financially impacted due to COVID-19, the SD CARES Housing Assistance Program may provide temporary housing or utility assistance for South Dakota residents who meet all criteria
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period, Rental Ledger

Program Name: Cheyenne River Sioux Indian Reservation Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) Program
Description: ​The Cheyenne River Housing Authority (CRHA) is the Tribally Designated Housing Entity (TDHE) will administer the Emergency Rental Assistance Program for the Cheyenne River Sioux Indian Reservation. Program provides direct financial assistance, including rent, rental arrears, utilities and home energy costs, utilities and home energy costs arrears, and other expenses related to housing.  Remaining funds are available for housing stability services, including case management and other services intended to keep households stably housed, and administrative costs.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, U.S. Citizens/Legal Aliens only, SSN
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, gas, water, sewer, and home emergy costs

Program Name: Flandreau Santee Sioux Tribe Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP)
Description: The Flandreau Santee Sioux Tribe is the grantee of an allocation of $496,591.21 to administer the Emergency Rental Assistance Program for the Flandreau Santee Sioux Indian Reservation. The formula for these funds is limited to eligible households who reside within the FSST service area, which is Moody County.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, SSN
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, gas, water, sewer, and home emergy costs

Program Name: Lower Brule Sioux Tribe Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: the Lower Brule Housing  has funding available for rent & utility assistance for families impacted either directly or indirectly by COVID 19? Yes, we do. It’s a new short-term program. The funds can assist low income families (at or below the 80% medium income guidelines) in paying  monthly rent & utilities. It includes payment of back rent up to 3/13/2020. Contact Lori or Tiauna (605-473-5522 or 5523) to see if you qualify for assistance.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, gas, water, sewer, and home emergy costs

Program Name: Oglala Sioux Tribe Emergency Rental & Utility Assistance Program
Description: If you are the head of household (HOH) living on the Pine Ridge Indian Reservation and have an emergency need for rental or utility assistance, you may be eligible for financial relief.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, gas, water, sewer, and home emergy costs

Program Name: Sicangu Wicoti Awayankape Corporation Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP)
Description: This Emergency Rental Assistance Program is funded by The Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2021, which is a federal program to help Tenants and Landlords, as well as improve public health conditions, during the COVID-19 pandemic. Program income guidelines, requirements and eligibility determination guidelines were set by the U.S. Department of Treasury.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility, unsafe or unhealthy living conditions
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, Trash, Water/Sewer, Propane, Fuel Oil, Natural Gas, Wood, and WiFi/Broadband
Types of Other Housing Expenses Covered: Relocation Expenses, Late Fees, Hotel/Motel Stays, Rent to Own, Lot Rent

Program Name: Tennessee Housing Development Authority COVID-19 Rent Relief
Description: THDA is administering a COVID-19 Rent Relief program for the majority of Tennessee**. Under guidance from the US Treasury, funds designated as part of the COVID-19 Rent Relief Act of 2020 will support renters who are or have been struggling to pay rent, utilities, or other home energy costs due to loss of wages/income as a result of the pandemic.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, gas, water, sewer, and trash collection

Program Name: Davidson County HOPE (Housing, Opportunity, Partnership and Employment) Program
Description: The COVID-19 Rent Relief program was developed to support renters who are or have been struggling to pay rent, utilities, or other home energy costs due to loss of wages/income as a result of the pandemic. Funding will be available to households for payment of delinquent (past due) expenses. In addition, eligible future rent may also be covered for eligible households.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water, sewer, and trash

Program Name: Knox Housing Assistance Program
Description: The Knox Housing Assistance Program is a joint City of Knoxville/Knox County initiative aiding renters adversely affected by the COVID-19 pandemic. Funding for this initiative is provided under the US Treasury Emergency Rental Assistance Program and is available for the payment of past due rent and/or utility expenses for eligible city and county households. Based on available funding, and number of applications received, future rent payments may be provided for applicants at high risk of experiencing homelessness.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified

Program Name: Rutherford County COVID-19 Rent Relief Program
Description: The Rutherford County COVID-19 Rent Relief Program will be used to support renters who are or have been struggling to pay rent, utilities or other home energy costs due to loss of wages/income as a result of the pandemic. Funding will be available for payment of delinquent (past due) expenses. Future rent payments may also be eligible for qualifying households.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utilities
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, gas, water, sewer, and trash collection

Program Name: Shelby County COVID-19 Emergency Rental and Utility Assistance Prgram
Description: Memphis and Shelby County are now accepting applications from citizens whose ability to pay rent and/or utilities have been impacted by COVID-19. The U.S. Department of Treasury has granted a total of $28.2 million to the City of Memphis and Shelby County (including 19.6 million to the City and 8.6 to the County) to administer the Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) program. The program will provide Shelby County residents direct financial assistance in the form of emergency rent and utility relief.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Unsafe or unhealthy living conditions, Other evidence of risk
Application Prioritization Specification: Active/ at risk of eviction, Utility shut-offs

Program Name: Texas Rent Relief
Description: The Texas Department of Housing and Community Affairs (TDHCA) has received approximately $1.3 billion in Emergency Rental Assistance funds from the newly passed Coronavirus Relief Bill Rental Assistance Program. TDHCA is using the funds to help Texas renters pay rent and utility bills (including past due rent and utilities).
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past Due Utilities, Risk of needing to move to unsafe or unhealthy living conditions
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Waive Late Fees, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period, Monthly rent must be $4,600 or less
Landlord Days to Respond Before Tenant C: 5 days (if notices made via phone, text, email) or 10 days (if notices made via mail)
Administering Agency: Texas Department of Housing and Community Affairs (TDHCA)
Allowable Areas of Self-Certification: COVID Hardship, Income Non-Traditional, Housing Instability
Types of Utilities Covered: Water, Gas/Propane, Electric, Sewer, Trash

Program Name: Arlington Cares Assistance
Description: The City of Arlington has received federal and state funding for several programs designed to assist Arlington tenants who have been impacted by the COVID-19 outbreak and cannot pay rent or have become homeless. The programs are managed by the Arlington Housing Authority who is currently accepting applications.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, U.S. Citizens/Legal Aliens only, SSN
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period

Program Name: Austin Relief of Emergency Needs for Tenants (RENT) Assistance Program
Description: The Relief of Emergency Needs for Tenants (RENT) Assistance Program provides $25 million of direct rent assistance for Austin renters making a low income and have been impacted by COVID-19. Rent payments are made directly to the landlord/property manager/property owner who is owed rent payments. More housing resources, eviction information, help with paying utilities and related housing services are available on the Housing Resources webpage.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utiility, unsafe or unhealthy living conditions
Administering Agency: Housing Authority of the City of Austin, Housing and Planning
Types of Utilities Covered: internet, garage, utilities, storage, pet and service animals.

Program Name: Bell County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP) using $10.9 million in CARES Act funds received from the U.S. Department of the Treasury.  This program offers aid to both landlords and tenants, who, due to the pandemic, are struggling to pay for rent and utility bills. To be eligible, a household must have an income that is at or below 80% of the Area Median Income (AMI), as defined by the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development. For households in Bell County, that means a maximum income of between $36,250 and $68,350, depending on the number of people in the household.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period, Rental Registry
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, trash removal, energy costs, such as fuel oil and internet.

Program Name: Brazoria County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Program is funded by the United States Treasury.  Counties across the nation with a populations over 200,000 people were given the choice to opt in to receive direct funding under this grant.  Brazoria County chose to opt in because we wanted to make sure that our share of the funding was able to directly benefit the residents of our great County.  This program assists residents of rental properties within the County that have experienced a reduction in income due to the Coronavirus pandemic.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Late notices, loans from individuals, banks, pawn shops, and/or payday lenders
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period AND Future Months
Allowable Areas of Self-Certification: COVID Hardship, Income, Income Non-Traditional, Lease
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, natural gas, water and sewer, trash removal, and internet. Disconnect or reconnect fees may also be included.
Types of Other Housing Expenses Covered: Relocation Expenses, Late Fees, Other Housing Expenses, Internet

Program Name: Brazos County Rental Assistance Program
Description: Beginning Monday, April 12, 2021, at 8:00 am, Brazos County residents experiencing housing instability due to COVID-19 may apply for rental and utility assistance.
