The more than $6.9-million in funds was granted to Brazos County by the U.S. Treasury’s Emergency Rental Assistance Program. The local program will be administered by Brazos County with assistance from the Brazos Valley Council of Governments.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Administering Agency: Brazos Valley Council of Governments, Brazos County

Program Name: Cameron County Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: The Cameron County Emergency Rental Assistance Program is available to renters in Cameron County whose income is at or below 80% of Area Median Income, who have been financially impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic, and who are experiencing housing instability. Funds are available for past due rent from March 13, 2020 to the present as well as for forward rent. Rent and utility payments are made directly to the landlord and utility provider.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, live in unsafe or unhealthy housing conditions
Administering Agency: Cameron County, Come Dream Come Build (cdcb)
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water, and sewer services

Program Name: Collin County Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP)
Description: Utilizing Coronavirus Response and Relief Supplemental Appropriations Act of 2021 funds, Collin County is launching the Emergency Rental Assistance Program (“ERAP”). This program will provide residential rent and utility assistance for residents of Collin County, excluding the City of Allen, City of Dallas, City of Frisco, City of Plano and City of McKinney. These cities listed will be operating their own programs.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Types of Utilities Covered: Water, electric, gas, sewer, trash, and internet
Types of Other Housing Expenses Covered: Late Fees, Internet, Other Housing Expenses

Program Name: Corpus Christi Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Corpus Christi is launching the U.S. Treasury Emergency Rental Assistance Program to provide emergency rental assistance to Corpus Christi residents who are at risk of experiencing homelessness or housing instability due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Proof of penalty or reconnection fees
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Waive Late Fees, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period AND Future Months, Proof of Ownership
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, natural gas, propane, water, sewer, trash removal, energy costs, internet

Program Name: City of Dallas COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The program can provide assistance for those negatively impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic for up to 12 months of past-due and future rent payments from March 2020 to December 2021. DHA can issue payments for up to $1,500 per month for rent assistance only. This program does not include utility payments. Landlords can also apply on behalf of their tenants.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, U.S. Citizens/Legal Aliens only, SSN, Government issued ID
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, living in an unstable housing situation
Administering Agency: DHA, Housing Solutions for North Texas, Dallas Rental Assistance Collaborative

Program Name: Dallas County Emergency Housing Assistance Program (EHAP)
Description: COVID-19 has had a widespread effect on the residents of Dallas County.  As a result of this pandemic may individuals and families have been economically impacted.  To mitigate the impact and support such individuals and families Dallas County Health and Human Services (DCHHS) is pleased to offer a host of short-term emergency housing assistance programs aimed at assisting individuals and households with rental, mortgage and utility (water/sewage) assistance.  Each of the programs are unique in the type of assistance covered, eligibility requirements, guidelines and funding source as seen below.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period, Housing Quality/Lead Inspection/Certificate
Administering Agency: Dallas County Health and Human Services
Types of Utilities Covered: water, electric, gas

Program Name: Denton County Eviction Prevention Program
Description: THE EVICTION PREVENTION PROGRAM was created to help Denton County residents avoid eviction and stay in their homes while also helping property managers and landlords avoid the eviction process. The Denton County nonprofit community is working collaboratively to help residents in need of rent and/or utility assistance.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified

Program Name: El Paso Rent Help
Description: The City of El Paso and County of El Paso EP Rent Help program provides rental assistance to landlords of residential rental properties for tenants that are experiencing economic hardship as a result of COVID-19 and live in El Paso County, including those who live in unincorporated areas of the county and those who live within the incorporated limits of El Paso, Horizon City, San Elizario, Socorro, Clint, Vinton, or Anthony, Texas.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Waive Late Fees, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period, Future Rent Increase Restrictions

Program Name: Fort Bend County Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA) Program
Description: The County has established a new ERA program, in compliance with federal, state and local guidelines, to provide assistance to eligible households through this new rental assistance program. If you are a Fort Bend County resident and meet income eligibility requirements, you are encouraged to apply for this program. The ERA Program will provide rent and/or utility assistance for up to twelve (12) months, or until funds are exhausted. This a NEW program, therefore you must apply to be considered.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, Form 1040; Utility bills if claimed; notice of disconnect or late notice of utilities
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Waive Late Fees, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period, Roster of eligible tenants

Program Name: Fort Worth City Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: The goal of this program is keeping families in their homes. Help is available for rent, past due rent, utilities, past due utility payments and other housing expenses resulting from the coronavirus outbreak. Funding is provided by U.S. Treasury Department and Texas Department of Housing & Community Affairs.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, SSN
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Rental Registry, SSN or manager EIN
Types of Utilities Covered: gas, water, electric, sewer, internet (only if covered by Landlord)

Program Name: Frisco City Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: On December 6, the U.S. Treasury Department announced the new $25 billion emergency rental assistance program authorized under the year-end COVID-19 relief and omnibus spending package.  The funds for awarded for City of Frisco residents is $6,058,027.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified

Program Name: City of Garland Emergency Rental Assistance Programs
Description: The City of Garland is offering an Emergency Assistance Program for Garland residents who need financial assistance with rent, utilities or both. (Note: this program is NOT available to support those with mortgages). Eligible applicants can receive up to 12 months' of support of past-due rent and/or utilities dating back to March 13, 2020.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, Proof of household size
Types of Utilities Covered: Gas, water, electric

Program Name: Houston-Harris County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The City of Houston and Harris County are working together to provide $157 million in rent and utilities assistance to families who are struggling due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The funds will be distributed by two agencies with established experience in helping people in need: BakerRipley and Catholic Charities of the Archdiocese of Galveston-Houston. To make the process as smooth as possible, a group of community agencies will serve as navigators, helping families complete their applications.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Waive Late Fees, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period, Accept Decreased Payment Amount
Administering Agency: BakerRipley, Catholic Charities of the Archdiocese of Galveston-Houston
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, water sewer, trash collection

Program Name: Hays County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Hays County Commissioners Court recently approved the implementation of a COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERA). This program may help with rental, utility and late fee assistance for applicants who have had difficulty paying rent due to the COVID-19 pandemic and who meet the program criteria. The funds will come from a federal grant.
Tenant Eligibility: 50% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, unsafe or unhealthy housing conditions
Application Prioritization Specification: After August 2, applicants facing immediate eviction will be prioritized

Program Name: Rent Help
Description: The Texas Emergency Rental Assistance Program has been developed to prevent, prepare for, and respond to the coronavirus (COVID-19). This program may provide up to six (6) months of consecutive rental assistance payments for qualifying families living within Hidalgo County, excluding McAllen, Mission and Edinburg, and will only be granted one time per household. Applications for assistance will be processed on a first come, first served basis.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Unspecified
Administering Agency: Affordable Homes of South Texas Inc.
Allowable Areas of Self-Certification: COVID Hardship, Income, Income Non-Traditional, Lease

Program Name: City of Irving Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The City of Irving is offering an Emergency Rental Assistance Program for Irving residents who need financial assistance with rent, utilities or both. (Note: this program is NOT available to support those with mortgages). Eligible applicants - those with Household Income at or below 80% AMI - can receive up to 12 months' of support of past-due rent and/or utilities dating back to March 13, 2020.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, Proof of household size
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, gas, water, sewer, trash, internet

Program Name: Jefferson County Emergency Rent Relief Program
Description: COVID-19 has affected Texans across the state. We have emergency funds available to help Jefferson County renters pay current and past due rent and utility bills. Both landlords and tenants can apply – even if the landlord has already sued for eviction in their local court. Households must have incomes at or below 80% of the Area Median Income and meet other eligibility requirements
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Administering Agency: South East Texas Regional Planning Commission
Types of Utilities Covered: utility and home energy

Program Name: Laredo COVID-19 Rental Assistance Program
Description: All told, the city received around $16 million to this end — via the Department of Housing and Urban Development, Department of the Treasury and from the state of Texas — much of which is specifically geared to help people who are at risk of eviction keep their homes.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status

Program Name: City of Lubbock Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The City of Lubbock Emergency Rent Assistance Program is designed to help residents of Lubbock County respond to and recover from the impacts of COVID-19. The program provides assistance to income-eligible households impacted by COVID-19 to help them stay housed during the pandemic. The program may provide financial assistance for current rent due, rent arrears, future rent assistance, and deposit fees for new residence. If you are facing eviction or at risk of eviction, this program may be able to help your and your family remain in your home.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Waive Late Fees, Eviction Restrictions, If lease expires during time covered by assistance, it must be extended
Administering Agency: City of Lubbock Community Development Department
Application Prioritization Specification: Referred under the Tenant Eviction Diversion Program; Active/ at risk of eviction

Program Name: McLennan County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The McLennan County Emergency Rental Assistance Program (MCERA) aids with rent payments to help families-in-crisis who have been affected by reduction in income, incurred significant costs, other financial hardship due, directly or indirectly, to COVID-19. To avoid an eviction, the MCERA program will assist families with rental assistance limited to 12 months. Assistance includes help for families who qualify and meet income guidelines established by the U. S. Department of the Treasury with rental and utility assistance to prevent and avoid evictions and homelessness.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease
Application Prioritization Specification: Place of employment closed due to city, county, or state public health order
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, gas, water, sewer

Program Name: City of Plano Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The City of Plano has a partnered with Catholic Charities of Dallas to administer a program that provides rent and utility assistance to low and moderate income households that have been financially impacted (decrease in income or increase in expenses) by the COVID-19 pandemic. If you need assistance completing this application or have questions please email CCDdisaster@ccdallas.org or call 214-257-0674.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Administering Agency: City of Plano and Catholic Charities of Dallas
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, gas, water, sewer

Program Name: San Antonio Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Applicants with a household income at or below 50% of the Area Median Income (AMI) will be eligible to receive up to nine (9) months of rent or mortgage assistance as well as assistance with current of SAWS, CPS, and internet bills. Cash assistance is no longer available but you will be connected to a benefits navigator to aid you in enrolling in long term benefits. You are not eligible for assistance if you have received assistance from the state or entity for the same months you are requesting assistance from the City.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease

Program Name: Smith County COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The PATH-Smith County COVID-19 Rental Assistance Program is available to renters within Smith County who have been financially impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic, who are experiencing housing instability, and whose income is at or below 80% of Area Median Family Income. We have emergency funds available to help Smith County renters pay rent and utility bills (including past due rent and utilities). Landlords are also eligible to participate in this program as long as they agree to the terms of the program.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utility

Program Name: Tarrant County COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Tarrant County Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP) is designed to assist eligible households who are unable to pay rent and/or utilities due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Assistance may be provided for unpaid, overdue rent (arrears) from April 1, 2020, and for future rent.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease

Program Name: Travis County Rental Assistance Program
Description: Travis County commissioners voted April 13 to establish a new program for emergency rental assistance, funded with $10.7 million from the federal Emergency Rental Assistance Program of the Coronavirus Response and Relief Supplemental Appropriations Act of 2021.

Program Name: Webb County Rental Assistance
Description: The Webb County Community Action Agency (CAA) announced they were awarded $427,890.30 in grant funds to benefit low-to-moderate income individuals economically impacted by COVID-19. To qualify for the program, certain criteria must be met. Priority of assistance will be given to households with incomes less than 50% of the area median income and to households with one or more members that have been unemployed for at least 90 days. Period of application by priority will be from March 15, 2021 to April 1, 2021.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Proof of Residency (General)

Program Name: Utah Rent Relief
Description: Utah renters who have been struggling to pay their housing and utility bills during the pandemic can now apply for emergency assistance. Some $215 million in rental relief is available to Utahns, who can now lodge requests for funding through rentrelief.utah.gov, the online portal the state rolled out Monday. Until now, renters have applied for this money through local community action agencies.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Unsafe or unhealthy living conditions
Types of Utilities Covered: Utilities, internet and home energy costs

Tribal Government/ Territory: Northwestern Band of the Shoshone Nation
Program Name: Northwestern Band of the Shoshone Nation COVID-19 Relief Program
Description: The Federal Government has provided Native American tribes with various amounts of Covid-19 relief funding for it’s tribal members and emergency preparedness programs as a result of the Covid-19 pandemic.
Tenant Eligibility: Unspecified
Administering Agency: Northwestern Band of the Shoshone Nation
Location: Northwestern Band of the Shoshone Nation

Tribal Government/ Territory: Ute Indian Tribally Designated Housing Entity
Program Name: Ute Indian Housing Authority Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Emergency Rental Assistance Program shall be administered by the Ute Indian Housing Authority to provide rental and utility assistance to eligible Ute Tribe member households and other eligible households. The program is federally funded through the United States Treasury Department. Assistance provided to eligible households under the program is contingent upon the availability of program funding.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Unspecified
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water, sewer, trash removal and energy costs, such as fuel oil
Location: Ute Indian Tribally Designated Housing Entity

Program Name: Vermont Emergency Rental Assistance Program (VERAP)
Description: The Vermont Emergency Rental Assistance Program (VERAP) was created to help renters dealing with financial challenges related to the COVID-19 pandemic. For eligible households, the program offers rental and utility assistance to help Vermonters avoid eviction or loss of utility service. Rent expenses include rent, rent arrears. Utilities include separately stated electricity, gas, water, sewer, trash removal and energy costs, such as fuel oil. ERAP was established by the Consolidated Appropriations Act 2021
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Past Due Rent, Unsafe or unhealthy living conditions
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Future Rent Increase Restrictions, Rental Ledger, Make reasonable effort to engage in weatherization programs
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water, sewer, trash removal and energy costs, such as fuel oil

Program Name: Virginia Rent Relief Program
Description: The Virginia Relief Program (RRP) is designed to support and ensure housing stability across the commonwealth during the coronavirus pandemic. Depending on availability of funds and household need, the RRP may provide financial assistance for rent payments for eligible households. This includes financial assistance for rent payments past due beginning April 1, 2020 and onward with opportunity for renewal based on availability of funding and the household’s need for additional assistance and continued eligibility.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utilities
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period
Administering Agency: Virginia Department of Housing and Community Development

Program Name: Chesterfield Emergency Rent and Utility Assistance (CERA)
Description: ACTS is administering the Chesterfield Emergency Rent and Utility Assistance (CERA) program to provide financial assistance to Chesterfield County renters who have experienced financial difficulty due to the COVID-19 Pandemic. Chesterfield residents can apply to ACTS to receive funds to pay delinquent rental payments dating as far back as April 1, 2020 and forward.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, 150% FMR or less
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Rental Ledger, Referral packet if applying on behalf of tenant

Program Name: Fairfax County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Funds are now available for Fairfax County landlords seeking rental assistance on behalf of their tenants. A new Landlord Portal, which launched recently, is connected to the efforts of the Evictions Taskforce and will provide landlords a front door to access the Emergency Rental Assistance funds. Fairfax County Residents: If you need assistance with your rent, call Coordinated Services Planning at 703-222-0880, TTY 711 Monday through Friday, 8 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, 150% FMR or less
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions, Rental Ledger
Administering Agency: Fairfax County Health and Human Services

Program Name: Monacan Nation Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: The assistance is on a first come, first serve basis to those who qualify (non-Native Americans as well) and affected by COVID-19. The aid is to provide relief for those behind in rent, utilities, etc. For applications visit Monacannation.com and schedule an appointment by calling (434) 363-4864. Applications also are available at the tribe’s office at 111 Highview Dr., Madison Heights.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability

Program Name: Washington State Treasury Rent Assistance Program (T-RAP)
Description: The Treasury Rent Assistance Program (T-RAP) Grant is intended to prevent evictions that would contribute to the spread of the virus by paying past due, current due, future rent,and utilities,targeting limited resources to thosewho have experienced financial hardship due to the COVID-19 outbreak and are atrisk of experiencing homelessness or housing instability. The program is administered locally. Find the locality serving you at the Dept. Of Commerce website.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status, 150% FMR or less
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utilities
Allowable Areas of Self-Certification: COVID Hardship, Income, Income Non-Traditional, Housing Instablity
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, trash removal and energy costs, such as fuel oil. Internet allowable

Program Name: Benton & Franklin Counties Rent Assistance Program
Description: The COVID-19 pandemic has affected our community in ways we could never imagine. Our local federal, state, and local policy makers have provided funding for rent assistance to pay back rent, utilities, and some future rent to help people stay housed in Benton and Franklin counties.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status, ID
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utilities

Program Name: Clark County Treasury Rent Assistance
Description: Has your household experienced negative financial impact due to COVID-19. Is your household at risk of experiencing homelessness or currently experiencing housing instability due to COVID-19 (for example: currently late on rent and/or has rental arrears, past due utilities). Household has not received Treasury Rent Assistance before.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Administering Agency: Clark County and Council for the Homeless
Allowable Areas of Self-Certification: COVID Hardship, Income, Income Non-Traditional, Housing Instablity
Types of Utilities Covered: utilities

Program Name: King County Eviction Prevention and Rental Assistance Program
Description: King County is starting the next round of the Eviction Prevention and Rental Assistance Program (EPRAP). The program helps people experiencing financial hardship due to COVID-19 who are at risk of housing instability or homelessness.
Tenant Eligibility: 50% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Landlord Requirements: Landlord must waive additional arrears if it exceeds 9 months
Administering Agency: King County Department of Community and Human Services, United Way King County
Application Prioritization Specification: Youth ages 18-24, and emancipated 16- and 17-year olds

Program Name: Kitsap Eviction Prevention Assistance
Description: Kitsap County has received funding for eviction prevention and utility assistance for renters impacted by COVID-19, who are behind on rent and are at risk of losing their housing. We anticipate many renters applying and appreciate your patience! Applicants must qualify as low-income at or below 50% Area Median Income (AMI).
Tenant Eligibility: 50% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability
Allowable Areas of Self-Certification: COVID Hardship, Income, Income Non-Traditional, Housing Instability, Lease
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, water, sewer, gas, garbage pickup, home energy

Program Name: Lewis County Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: Almost $5 million in emergency rental assistance is set to funnel into Lewis County — a major increase from the $776,000 that helped a little more than 200 renters throughout the pandemic. Applications are now open for the funds that could help as many as 900 households, according to Meja Handlen, housing coordinator for Lewis County Public Health and Social Services. Still, it’s “far less than the need,” she said.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less

Program Name: Pierce County Rental Assistance
Description: The purpose of the Rental Assistance program is to prevent eviction for Pierce County residents (including those living in the City of Tacoma) impacted by COVID-19 who are behind on rent. Applicants must qualify as low-income at or below 80% Area Median Income (AMI), but priority will be given to those under 50% AMI. Below is a snapshot of income limits per household:
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease
Types of Utilities Covered: Electric, Water/Sewer, Gas, Garbage Pickup, Fuel Oil, and Internet

Program Name: Skagit County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Skagit County nonprofits will begin distributing $8.9 million in assistance Monday for those struggling to pay their rents during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease
Administering Agency: Community Action of Skagit County, Catholic Community Services, Volunteers of America, Northwest Youth Services and the Housing Authority of Skagit County

Program Name: Snohomish County Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: Qualified Snohomish households will be able to receive 12 months of rent assistance, including rental arrears.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status

Program Name: City of Spokane Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: The City of Spokane and its partners are running this rental assistance program to address the hardship faced by our community. This emergency rental assistance program is intended for those who have been disproportionately impacted by the COVID-19 outbreak. Funds are available for past due, current due, future rent and utilities. In this webpage we will share with you information about the application process, provide FAQs for tenants and landlords, and share simple resources that simplify this process.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Administering Agency: City of Spokane and FORWARD, plus partners
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water/sewer, trash removal, energy costs, such as fuel oil. Internet on case-basis
Types of Other Housing Expenses Covered: Relocation Expenses, Late Fees, Hotel/Motel Stats, Internet, Other Housing Expenses

Program Name: Spokane County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Rental assistance programs open March 24th, through SNAP for County residents. The funds provided in ERA are to provide financial assistance and housing stability services to eligible households.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past Due Utility

Program Name: Thurston County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Eviction Rent Assistance Program (ERAP) is intended to prevent evictions by paying past due, current, due and future rent, targeting limited resources to those with the greatest needs while working to distribute the funds equitably.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status

Program Name: Whatcom Rental Assistance Program
Description: Funds will be distributed through the Opportunity Council and could help 1,000 to 1,500 households earning 80% or less of the average median income, which is $47,800 for a single person and $68,250 for a family of four, according to 2020 Housing and Urban Development data.Funds will provide rental aid for up to 12 months, including back rent and advance payment to landlords.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Unspecified

Program Name: Yakima County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Yakima County has secured $28 million dollars to go towards rental assistance programs for our community. These funds will help stabilize tenant households who have struggled throughout the pandemic, and provide restitution to landlords of qualifying tenants who have not received rental payments. Qualifying tenants may receive assistance with up to 12 months of rental payments, to be paid directly to their landlords.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Unspecified
Administering Agency: Yakima County Department of Human Services

Program Name: Chehalis Tribal Housing Authority COVID-19 Emergency Assistance Program
Description: Chehalis Tribal Housing Authority is happy to announce it is offering an Emergency Rental Assistance Program. Program funds from the Department of Treasury became available March 1. CTHA is accepting applications for the program and can aid with pas, current and future utility bills and rental payment to eligible households.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Unspecified
Application Prioritization Specification: First preference will be given to eligible households that have at least one family member who is a Chehalis tribal member. Second preference will be given to eligible households that have at least one family member who is a member of an Indian Tribe.

Program Name: Colville Tribe Emeregency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The purpose of the program is to provide financial assistance for rent/utilities to Indian families who are in immediate need due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Applicant must reside in the CIHA Service Area: (Enrolled Colville Tribal Members encouraged to apply regardless of location): CCT Reservation and Off-Reservation Trust Land Chelan County, Perry County, Okanogan County, Douglas County, and Stevens County
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Past due utilities; Unsafe or unhealthy living conditions
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, trash removal and energy costs, such as fuel oil

Program Name: Lummi Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Lummi Nation received a grant from Department of Treasury to help with rental assistance. March 1st will mark the beginning of the program, and the opportunity for those that qualify for the rental assistance. Applications can be picked up at Kwina Village Resident Center, LHA, Commods and the Admin building. This program will go until the end of the year, so space is NOT limited.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Unspecified, Tribal ID
Types of Utilities Covered: power, water, sewer, garbage, propane

Program Name: Port Gamble S'Klallam Tribe COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The purpose of the program is to provide financial assistance for rent/utilities to Indian families who are in immediate need due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Tribal ID; SSN
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, trash removal and energy costs, such as fuel oil

Program Name: Spokane Tribe of Indians Temporary Emergency Rental & Utility Assistance Program
Description: The purpose of the program is to provide financial assistance for rent/utilities to Indian families who are in immediate need due to the COVID-19 pandemic: Preference will be given to Spokane Tribal Members and eligible households that include an individual who has been unemployed for the 90 days prior to application for assistance and households with income at or below 50 percent of the area median income.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Tribal ID; SSN
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, trash removal and energy costs, such as fuel oil

Program Name: Tulalip Tribes Emergency Rental Assistance Program (TERAP)
Description: Tulalip has received COVID funding from the Department of Treasury for households who are renting and experiencing risk of homelessness or housing instability, experiencing COVID-related hardships, and meet the 80% of Average Medium Income (AMI) for Snohomish County. Preference will be given to households that are at or below 50% AMI.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Tribal ID; SSN
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer,trash removal and energy costs, such as fuel oil.

Program Name: Yakama Nation Emergency Rental Assistance COVID-19
Description: The purpose of the ERA program is to provide assistance to low-income tribal members and other Indian Family Households who have suffered from impacts of the COID-19 pandemic Cover retns, utilities, and other Housing costs
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Tribal ID; SSN
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water, sewer, trash removal, internet

Program Name: West Virginia Mountaineer Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Mountaineer Rental Assistance Program (MRAP) offers financial assistance to renters and landlords affected by the coronavirus outbreak. WV anticipates receiving rental assistance funding from the U.S Department of Treasury in the next few weeks. As we await guidance from the US Treasury, we will need time to work out the details of how that funding will be allocated to renters in need in our state. We know help is needed and we are working hard to get help to our rental families quickly.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Acceptable Proof of Housing Instability: Eviction Notice, Past Due Rent, Any other evidence of such risk as determined by the program guidance
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Waive Late Fees, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period
Application Prioritization Specification: Active/ at risk of eviction, Utility shut-offs
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water, sewer, trash removal, internet

Program Name: Wisconsin Emergency Rental Assistance (WERA)
Description: WISCAP and its statewide network will be helping to get Wisconsin Emergency Rental Assistance (WERA) to those in need. Please read the Frequently Asked Questions sheet for program guidelines and eligibility. The program will be administered by 14 community agencies
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions During Covered Period, Signed landlord agreement

Program Name: Northeast Wisconsin Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: Wisconsin residents that have experienced a significant loss of income due to the COVID-19 pandemic and need help with their rent can apply. Brown County funds can be used for utility arrears (heat, electric, water & sewer, and trash).
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Types of Utilities Covered: Electricity, gas, water and sewer, trash removal and energy costs, such as fuel oil. Internet expenses are eligible for assistance if they're related to remote work, virtual learning and telemedicine.

Program Name: Dane CORE Program
Description: The City of Madison and Dane County recently announced the availability of up to $16 million of emergency rental assistance from the federal government that will be used to support payment of rent arrears. These emergency funds are essential to our community and we recognize the need for them to be dispersed quickly to support struggling tenants and landlords. In order to meet the anticipated demand for these funds, the City and County are working with Tenant Resource Center to open applications for emergency rental assistance the week of February 15th.
Tenant Eligibility: 50% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Eviction Restrictions, Rental Ledger
Application Prioritization Specification: 30% AMI or less, Currently at risk of default of court order payment plan, Eviction history,  and whether property owner is local to Dane County

Program Name: Milwaukee Emergency Rental Assistance (MERA) program
Description: The Milwaukee Emergency Rental Assistance program, also known as MERA, is a new program administered by SDC providing rental assistance to eligible residents of the City of Milwaukee.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status

Program Name: Milwaukee County Rental Assistance Program
Description: Community Advocates, which has distributed over $11 million in rent assistance since last March, now has an additional  $10.6 million to disburse through Milwaukee County. Both landlords and tenants can continue to apply at Community Advocates’ website.  Landlords can now reach out on behalf of tenants, though tenants must complete the application on their own. Once applications are approved, funding is paid directly to the landlord.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General)

Program Name: Waukesha County Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: Waukesha County announced a $12 million emergency rental assistance program Friday “to help people experiencing financial hardship to stay in their homes because of the COVID-19 pandemic.”
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Proof of Residency (General), Current Lease

Program Name: Bad River Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: The Bad River Housing Authority ERAP offers financial relief to help home-renters pay their rent and utilities during the COVID-19 Pandemic. Applicants who receive relief funds can use it to pay past due and current rent / utility bills.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Tribal ID; SSN
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Rental Ledger, Tribal ID, SSN
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, trash removal, and energy costs (such as fuel oil)

Program Name: Ho-Chunk Nation Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: HHCDA has new funding available to assist renters with rental arrears, utility arrears, prospective (future) rent. HHCDA offers eligible households assistance with current or late rent, energy or utility bills, and other housing costs dating back to the start of the pandemic. Applicants must be a rental resident who has experienced a significant income loss or costs due directly or indirectly to COVID-19, is at risk of experiencing homelessness or housing instability, and has a household income at or below 80% of the area median income.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Tribal ID; SSN
Landlord Requirements: W-9/Payee Information, Rental Registry, Tribal ID, SSN
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas, water and sewer, trash removal, and energy costs (such as fuel oil)

Program Name: Menominee Indian Tribe COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: The Tribe received funding to support community members with rent and utility expenses through the Emergency Rental Assistance Program. The program is being managed by our Housing Department and is designed to assist individuals experiencing hardship due to COVID. Applicants must meet income requirements and show proof of hardship.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Unspecified, Tribal ID

Program Name: Oneida Emergency Rental/Utility Assistance Program
Description: Oneida Nation provide rent/utility assistance for the following: An enrolled Oneida Tribal Member or Oneida Descendent living in the United States; Non-Tribal member living within the Oneida reservation boundaries.; Must be 18 years or older with a valid lease; Suffered impacts due to COVID related issue(s); and Income must be below 80% of the median income of their residential county.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status, SSN
Types of Utilities Covered: water/sewer, gas, electricity, internet, fuel, wood

Tribal Government/ Territory: Red Cliff Band Of Lake Superior Chippewa
Program Name: Red Cliff Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Red Cliff Emergency Rental Assistance Program offers financial relief to help home-renters pay their rent and utilities during the COVID-19 Pandemic. Applicants who receive relief funds can use it to pay past due and current rent / utility bills.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, SSN
Types of Utilities Covered: water/sewer, gas, electricity, internet, fuel, wood
Location: Red Cliff Band Of Lake Superior Chippewa

Program Name: Wyoming Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: On February 8, 2021, Governor Gordon signed Executive Order 2021-02.  The Order directs the Wyoming Department of Family Services (DFS) to begin planning to implement the ERAP. In accordance with that Executive Order, DFS and other state agencies and community partners are actively planning for this new program.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Open to All Regardless of Citizenship Status
Allowable Areas of Self-Certification: COVID Hardship, Income, Income Non-Traditional, Housing Instability, Lease
Types of Other Housing Expenses Covered: Relocation Expenses, Late Fees, Hotel/Motel Stays, Other Housing Expenses

Program Name: Eastern Shoshone Housing Authority Emeregency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The U.S. Department of Treasury awarded the Eastern Shoshone Tribe $1.8M for an Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERA). This will provide rent and utility assistance for families affected by the pandemic. Application available on Facebook page, dated March 17th
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas,water and home energy costs

Program Name: Wind River Emergency Rental Assistance Program
Description: The Northern Arapaho Tribal Housing Program was allocated 2.6 million dollars to assist households that are unable to pay rent and utilities due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The ERA Program must be used for unpaid rent and utility bills for rental households only. Eligible utilities are: electricity, gas,water and home energy costs only. The ERA Program is a temporary program under the Northern Arapaho Tribal Housing. Individuals – native or non – in rental households located on the Wind River Indian Reservation, Wyoming and Wind River Tribal members that reside out-of-state are eligible for assistance through The ERA Program.
Tenant Eligibility: 80% AMI or less, COVID Hardship, Housing Instability, Current Lease, Tribal ID; SSN
Types of Utilities Covered: electricity, gas,water and home energy costs

Tribal Government/ Territory: Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands
Program Name: Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance
Description: Currently, the CCERA program is being offered to US Citizens and qualifying individuals with a Permanent Resident Card or Long-Term CNMI Resident status.
